snippets.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |

एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदुः |

स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्तः पुरातनः |
snippets.transliteration:
śrībhagavānuvāca .

evaṃ paramparāprāptamimaṃ rājarṣayo viduḥ .

sa evāyaṃ mayā te.adya yogaḥ proktaḥ purātanaḥ .
verseTranslations: "Lord Shri Krishna said: This imperishable philosophy I taught to Viwaswana, the founder of the Sun dynasty, Viwaswana gave it to Manu the lawgiver, and Manu to King Ikshwaku!
The Divine Kings knew it, for it was their tradition. Then, after a long time, at last it was forgotten.
It is the same ancient Path that I have now revealed to thee, since thou are My devotee and My friend. It is the supreme Secret.
snippets.commentary:
We had been discussing chapter four, Gnana Karma Sannyasa Yoga Yoga of Renouncing Karma in Knowledge. We have completed discussion on chapter three, Karma Yoga. In Karma Yoga we have seen how to act in this world so that we are not bound by our actions. But our goal actually in life is to become actionless, to retire from my activity. So if somebody says, why Neil, you are working so hard now I am working hard to become actionless in my retirement and how do I want to achieve that? If I can become financially independent so that I don't depend on the outside income, as long as I'm dependent on outside income, I have to keep working.

Somebody have to generate income from outside. So I'm continuing to work. The harder I work, obviously the more conflicts I create and more situation which makes me unhappy. More I think I'm controlling the situation. The situation controls me. So what I want to do is to create a situation where I don't have to work with the outside world for my well being.

That's what we call it, a retirement. So that's why we have this 401k and IRA and all of that. That will make me independent. Once I'm financially independent, I don't depend on my outside income, then I can do what I want. Every year I took a cruise and I realized that most of the population of the Cruise is above 55. 80% of the people were senior citizens.

So all the programs were geared towards senior citizens. So I was actually pitying all the young people who were there like in minority. I want to do what I want to do. So the goal is always to be actionless, that I don't want to interact with this world. In last chapter we learned exactly same thing for all these activities it says Yahatu Atmaratiyeva, Everyone has duty to act in this world according to their own dharma, according to the roles they are playing. It comes with all the Niyata Karma, all these ordained duties.

So you have to continue doing your duties. But there is Only one exception. One who is atmaratihi who is reveling in himself. He's not dependent on anything or anybody outside to be happy. Atmatruptastamaanava who is self content. If I'm reveling in myself, I'm self content.

Atmani evacha santushtaha tasya kariyam na vidyaday the only time you have no duty to act, to do any work or any action is when you meet this condition. Atmaratehe full of yourself. Not a right way to put it back. So you have no real need to depend on outside world. Once you are not depending on outside world, there is no question for having a conflict with the outside world. It's only we are dependent on them.

When we have conflict. I am dependent on my employees. My employees are dependent on me. We constantly have conflict. You are not coming on time. You didn't do what I thought I was going to be doing.

He feels the same way. Neil, you are not doing what I thought you were going to do for me. Because we are dependent on each other. If I am not dependent on them. We have projected Dominion and it's really going not anywhere because we are updating the auditorium. And the CEO of the company will be the first meeting there on 23rd.

And the project is supposed to be complete end of March. It is not completed now. We don't know whether it's going to complete on the 23rd. So often hours because the CEO is going to be there, they call me up, they call everybody. Obviously we blame everybody else contracted into this. Why did you specify Neil?

Something which comes from Japan, all this good stuff. So I asked the guys, did you always have this problem? The guy who's in charge at Dominion, he said the only time I don't have problem is I don't depend on anybody. When I do work myself, that's my problem too. I have to depend on the contractor. I have to depend on you.

We all know for sure. Then when I don't have depend on other people, then I'm free. He has no employees to worry about. His structural engineer, he was a one man firm and did very well. Because he's not dependent on his employees. He knows what he can do, what he cannot do and he can promise accordingly.

On my case, I have to depend on 15 other people when I promise what they're going to do. So in our life we have figured out that the only way to be free is not to be dependent on anybody. At the same token, my happiness right now is mortgage with this world outside. They determine whether I can be happy or not. So Bhagawan said that the goal of life is to become actionless. I'll become actionless when I'm not dependent on others for my happiness.

So we learn that Yahatu Atmaratihiva, one who is reveling in himself, atmatrupta satisfied by his own self, atmaniyevacha Santustah is content by himself. Then he does not have to do anything. But the same token, I have to continue to work in this world. So I need to understand what is the way I can stop acting. And this chapter, the title says Gnana Karma Sannyasa. When the knowledge occurs, what is happiness?

What is that I'm seeking? Then all actions I can renounce. So now we are further taking our discussion on actions to next level. We understood that I need to act in a manner that I'm not attached to the actions. And also I should be acting in a way that it is good for everyone, that is for the greater good. Then I will not be bound by my actions.

But how do I reach to that point? I need to have the knowledge. My actions without knowledge obviously are not producing the result which I need to produce. So the next level of discussion in the actions is now how do you achieve that state where I have the knowledge? So the chapter titled Gnana Karma Sannyasa Yoga Bhagawan doesn't even wait for Arjuna to ask any question. He comes out and gives him his version of what we're going to do next.

Sri Bhagavanu Vacha Imam Vivasvate Yogam proktavan Aham Avyam Vivasvaan Manavai Praha Manohu Isvakave Abravit said, I'm now going to teach you the yoga which is imperishable. That knowledge has never become outdated. We used to learn something probably in last century about driving a horse buggy. In this century we are learning how to drive car. It will become invalid pretty soon if these guys are all successful. We used to put a lot of emphasis on handwriting, at least architecture.

Our whole life in the architecture school was how nicely I can write. It's called architectural script. We spent all our life to perfect our handwriting. Nobody writes anymore. You can't differentiate my drawing from anybody else. We used to take great pride in that.

Even if there is work left and there Is no enough time. Somebody says, can I help you, Neel? I want to make sure that nobody else handwriting is on my drawing. Because once somebody says, oh, that's Neil's drawing. I don't want somebody's handwriting on it. But now all drawings look same, no matter where it come from because it's computer.

So the skills which we were learning, which was so dear to us is no more valid. But one said this yoga is not like that, it's universal. It was always valid in the past, it's valid now and it will be valid forever. Ivam Vivasvate Yogam Proktava vyam I taught this yoga to Vivaswan and then Vivaswan Manavai Prah Vivaswan then taught in turn to the Manu. The Manu in dint taught to Manu Isva kavet. He is now making sure that you understand that this is not something I just made up suddenly.

This is an imperishable yoga. This knowledge is imperishable. It's applicable at any given age. So it starts with that. This knowledge is so ancient. It starts with the beginning of this creation.

In our world, the creation started with Sun. We at least know from our high school science that this earth came out of Sun. And then obviously all the development in the earth is because of that solar energy. So our source at our level is Sun. We don't have to go any further than that. So he said, even when the sun was created, this knowledge was there.

So Vivaswani son I the Lord the first time, as Swamiji says, Krishna comes out as I am the Lord. In this conversation, the Creator, the knowledge giver is saying, this knowledge always available from the beginning of this creation. So I gave it to the first created entity, the Sun. That son gave it to his son, which is Manu. From our puranic point of view, Viva Swan was the original entity. The Manu has his son and then the whole progeny starts and we end up here.

In this class I taught to Lord sun who is the originator of our world. Then he in turn taught to his sons. Obviously we always pass on our knowledge from us to our children. That's why we start teaching the little kids. And yesterday we were in the park and Medha always like to swing. The only way to stop her is say we're going to count one to hundred.

So in 100 you have to come down. That's okay, we start 1, 2. And she said no, we're going to count in Spanish. So she starts in uno dwe. Okay, after that what? Meda after that what?

Because she has to tell us now. She knows because of the Dora they explorer. So we teach our children what we know. So Bhagavan said that Lord's son taught to his sons what he knew, this imperishable yoga. Then Manu in turn taught to his son. So Ishvaku, Ishwaku, we all know from Ramayana is the ancestor of Rama of the Sun Dynasty.

Sun Dynasties came from whether we like this historically or not. But that's how the Purana describe how our lineage is. The point here is very simple. Right from the beginning of our ancestry, this knowledge was available to people. And those people passed on from one generation to another through the leaders of the society. The leaders obviously in those days were kings.

They were the people who were leading the society. So if you read historically that Manu led these people from wherever they were to the land which was more safer and fertile. Actually the professor Bargha, he said that Noah is same as Manu because in Sanskrit Manu is Manu hu. The people in the Arabic world only put nu. They drop the ma and nu, then nu in the western world become Noah. So if you read the story of the Noah's Ark, very similar to what we have in Amapurana, the Great Flood.

So we know that there's some connection somewhere where some ancestor left some land which was not very conducive and was flooding all the time. Well, let's go to somewhere. So he led his people to this. So he's our ancestor Manu Adi Manu. And whether he was the first human being is left to your imagination. We know for sure that he was the first Aryan king in this lineage of the Aryan kings who ruled Arya worth for ages.

So he said the first person to know this knowledge in this lineage, Manu. Manu in turn will give it to his sons. He came to Ishwaku who was the ancient king of Solar dynasty.

snippets.sanskrit:
अर्जुन उवाच |

श्रीभगवानुवाच |

अजोऽपि सन्नव्ययात्मा भूतानामीश्वरोऽपि सन् |
snippets.transliteration:
arjuna uvāca .

śrībhagavānuvāca .

ajo.api sannavyayātmā bhūtānāmīśvaro.api san .
verseTranslations: Arjuna asked: My Lord! Viwaswana was born before Thee; how then canst Thou have revealed it to him?
Lord Shri Krishna replied: I have been born again and again, from time to time; thou too,O Arjuna! My births are known to Me, but thou knowest not thine.
have no beginning. Though I am imperishable, as well as Lord of all that exists, yet by My own will and power do I manifest Myself.
snippets.commentary:
We had been discussing chapter four, Gnana Karma Sannyasa Yoga Yoga of Denouncing actions in Knowledge. So so far we have learnt in Bhagavad Gita that the sole goal of any being is happiness. And happiness we have seen is defined as absence of unhappiness. As long as there is unhappiness somewhere, I cannot be happy. Just like as we have seen, the cold is defined as absence of heat is cold. Darkness is defined as absence of light is darkness.

Happiness is defined by lack of unhappiness. So my true nature is actually happiness. But the infusion of unhappiness creates this state which I call it going back from happiness to unhappiness. Happiness and unhappiness. When there is no unhappiness, I am happy. No matter how many other things are getting well in my life, it just won't let me focus on that.

In Sastra it's called Kakadrasti. A crow is flying over a garden and everything else is beautiful underneath. But crow is not focusing on all the beautiful flowers. He is focused on a Caracas which is lying in that garden. That's where he goes. So our Kakadra stays.

We don't focus on what is right in our life, we focus on what is wrong in our life. So we have to get out of this habit of seeing what is not right in my life. So what we try to do is keep searching for happiness rather than avoiding unhappiness. The search of happiness leads us to believe that my actions will get me to happiness. So we act in this world to achieve happiness which is already with us. But these actions also lead me to results which are unhappiness.

So therefore we have seen in last chapter, Arjuna's question is Atha KE na prayuk toyam Papam Charati Purusha. There is no one in this life who really wants to become unhappy. And still we end up becoming unhappy by our own actions. So the actions are at the root cause of whether I'm happy or unhappy. So therefore we need to understand what the actions are all about. So the one thing we learnt is I can live without actions because actions is the very nature of my own being.

Nature is part of Prakriti. It is one of the attributes of Prakriti is action Rajas. And as I am part of Prakriti, as this body, mind, intellect is part of Prakriti, action is a very signature of my being who I am. So actions I cannot avoid that's given. Now how can I avoid actions which gives me unhappiness? Well again, when I am performing actions, there is not a single action I perform because I want to be unhappy.

Well, let me do something that makes me unhappy. Let's see how it feels like. There is no curiosity about unhappiness. I really don't want to know. But I still end up being unhappy. That because I'm not understanding what accents are all about.

So we learnt in chapter three what accents are all about. The first thing we learnt is Yajnaarthaat Karmano, Nyatra Loko Yam Karma, Bandanaha. All accents are binding. If they are not performed for the Yajna for the spirit of common good, then it is binding. If I am doing it for myself, they are binding. When those actions are binding, I'll be bound by the results.

In a sense, I really don't know what the results would be. They may come back as conducive results and I'll be happy or they come back as unconducive results and I'll be unhappy. So now I am in a conundrum. I want to act because that's what's going to make me happy. But also I'm not quite confident that my actions will make me happy. Because I have no control over my actions.

So there got to be a way to get out of this conundrum of acting and reacting and then acting again. So Bhagavan said yes, there is a yoga, the Yoga of Knowledge. Once the knowledge takes place that I am not the actor, you will be released from this bondage of actions. Because you are not performing the actions, you cannot be bound by it. So that is Gnana Karma Sannyasa Yoga. Yoga of renouncing actions in knowledge.

When knowledge takes place that I am not the actor. Guna Gunesuvartantaha Ithimatva na Sajjadhai. We learned that in chapter three. Once I figure out that the actions are only taking place in the Prakriti level by my qualities, qualities of my body Mind and intellect and qualities of rest of the universe. When they come in contact with each other, they react with each other. When they are two independently standing, there is no water.

When they come together, they create water. We also work in this world the same way. By ourselves we are not reacting to anything. As soon as we come in contact with another being or an object, we react. There was sometimes we had good chemistry with him. What do you mean good chemistry?

I like him with no reason. Guna Gunesuvaratanta. I detect Gunas in him or her. Maybe a physical, mental, intellectual, something which I like. I tell people how I got into hotel designing business. Very first limited hotel.

I had designed full service hotels in my life before I came to Virginia. But then I was looking for some work. Somebody says there is an Indian community. They design lot of mid level hotel. He said no, no, you're a big time, not small time. So the first guy they introduced me was in Charlottesville.

How about they said let me come down there. Because one thing I figured out, I can win people over if I'm in front of them on phone and writing. But if I'm in front of him I can probably have a better chance. So let me come down there. So I go down there, talk to the guy and then he said, you know, where are you from? But where in Vijay says Surat.

My parents actually come from Randeh. Oh, where is Randeir? In the end of the day we never talked about what do I know about architecture. They said you are my architect now because your ancestors come from Randir. Let the architecture sort out by itself. You are my architect.

Something we find common. So therefore these actions are all bound by Gunas. But we consider it to be ours. The Bhagawan said that one who is understanding this he will not be attached to his actions. He doesn't get attached. But how do I get to that point that I don't get attached.

I have to have knowledge who I am. So this chapter starts with Bhagavan said that I taught this yoga to Vivaswan. Then the Viva swan taught to Manu. Then Manu taught to Iksvaku. And thus by lineage the knowledge was passed on to generation to generation. But now because the long time has passed the knowledge is lost.

When was Vivaswan and Manu and you are now telling me that you taught them. And we have discussed that Vivaswan and Manu from a genealogical point of view we know that they are Krishna's ancestors. Vivaswan's son was Manu who time of Pralaya saved his family and seven Rishis. And then Manu's descendants. Manu's son was Ikswaku. So Vivaswan taught his son Manu.

Manu taught his son Ishvaku. And Isvaku we know is Rama's ancestor who established the kingdom in Ayodhya. And somewhere about 36 generations Rama comes. One of them was the ancestor of Krishna. Somewhere in 60th generation Krishna comes. They say you are telling me that you are teaching all your ancestors even if you don't consider Vyvaswana son.

So then Bhagavan said Bahuni me Vyati Thani Janmani Stavacharjuna Tani Aham Veda Sarwani Natvam Vedaparam Tapa. This is not the only life that you and I know, Arjuna. You know me in this life as Krishna. But I have taken so many births before and so did you. The only difference is I know them all. This is a very bold presentation of concept of reincarnation.

It was not that it was not introduced before. It was introduced in chapter 2. Vasamsi Jinini Yatavi Haya Navani Guru Nathi Naroparani we have already seen that this self is immutable, imperishable. It just takes one state of existence to another depending on. We know from our study of Bhagavadya by Karma actions. Our actions create experiences in this world.

These experiences create tendencies. These tendencies create likes and dislikes and desires. And to fulfill those desires we take a next state of existence. My desire was to become a rock star. Then obviously I learned music and then march on that path. So desire leads us to where we are today.

But you see, we won't remember how we got here. But the one who is very aware of this transitory nature of things he will remember all of them. See, some of us are very good at remembering dreams. But all of us remember dreams, right? Some of my dreams even I had in childhood, I still remember. Either still scares me or still fascinates me.

But I don't remember all my dreams. Let's assume that if I was so enlightened about keeping connected myself to my dream world then I would know all my dreams See, right now I'm only connected to my waking world. And sporadically I'm connected to my dream world. So I remember some dreams here and there, but not all of them waking world. I think I remember everything. Then somebody says, but Neil, you did this?

No, I don't remember. I forget almost everything she says I did. She said you did this for some reason. Women are very historical. They remember everything. From the day I met Meena till today she remembers everything that I did not do right?

And I don't remember any of that. But you remember what she didn't do, right? So we have very, what you call it is a convenient memory. But at least I'm connected to the waking world. If I'm disconnected, then I will have to have psychiatric evaluation because I don't remember who I am and all the good stuff. If you imagine as I'm connected to waking, well, if I'm also connected to my dream world, then also my deep sleep, then I will remember everything.

But for that I have to be a third party not involved in it. So soon that there is recording device which is recording everything which is going in my brain. It will record everything. See, that's why when we see some of the recordings of our own childhood, we get fascinated. Did I look like that? So we have a memory which is very specific to time and space.

The time and space we are in. This is what remember as the reality. But if there is some way we can connect all our realities then we will have a complete view. Bhagawan said that you and I both have the capability to know that. But because of ignorance that who I am has created smaller memory. More I identify with the localized situation.

More I will forget about my greater situation. Some of my friends still writes me every year and I have forgotten most of them because my nature is to wherever I am now I'm in Richmond. These are my friends and my family. More I identify with Richmond. More I'll forget my friends in Northern Virginia and Houston and Nairobi and Zambia and India. But some people keep remain connected because they never belong to where they are.

They may ask somebody and say, what are you doing? We go to Northern Virginia every weekend. We have all our friends there. They are not connected here, they are more connected there.

snippets.sanskrit:

snippets.transliteration:
yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānirbhavati bhārata .

paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṃ vināśāya ca duṣkṛtām .

verseTranslations: Whenever spirituality decays and materialism is rampant, then, O Arjuna, I reincarnate Myself!
To protect the righteous, to destroy the wicked and to establish the kingdom of God, I am reborn from age to age.
He who realises the divine truth concerning My birth and life is not born again; and when he leaves his body, he becomes one with Me.
snippets.commentary:
We had been discussing chapter four, Gnana Karma Sannyasa Yoga, Yoga of Renunciation of Action in Knowledge. We have seen so far that in chapter three, Bhagavan has taught Arjuna Karma Yoga. In that he said that you should perform actions for Yajna Yajnarth Puru Karmani. Then he also said, asaktah Sattattam Karma Samajaraha. Perform all your actions without attachment. And he said, yogastha Guru Karmani, establish your Sulmi Yoga and they perform your actions.

So these are the three requisites or three path. Three ways of performing actions Bhagavan has indicated to Arjuna and he called it Karma Yoga. How you can continue performing your actions in this world as required by roles you are taken. The art of performing action called Karma Yoga. Bhagavan Seth was taught to the royal sages, the philosopher kings, right from the beginning. Right from the beginning of the creation.

This knowledge was given to Lord sun, who is considered to be in this case, the original ruler of this universe. He then gave it to his successor. His successor gave it to his successor. And this knowledge was passed on one royal sage to the another, one philosopher king, to another philosopher king. You know, kings were not just simply the rulers, but they were also established in Dharma. They were established in the knowledge.

But this knowledge was lost over a period of time. And therefore I have given it to you again today, and you shall also be able to use it. But then Arjuna asked, how can that be possible? Because you are under my contemporary, how you could give this knowledge to Lord Son. And in that response we all learned how the reincarnation works. So Bhagavan said, bahuni me vyati Thani Janma ne tava Charjana.

Oh Arjuna, you and I have gone through many, many Janmas, many, many iterations of our existence. The only difference, he is saying that I know them all and you do not know any. That's because you take birth. I, as a Jiva, take birth, compelled by my own vasanas. My unfulfilled desires. I take a new instrument to fulfill my vasanas which I have not fulfilled yet.

If I have no vasanas, no desires, there is no reason for me to take birth. In other words, there is no action required if there is no desire. I don't need to buy a car if I am never going to travel. People in New York City, most of them don't buy car because they are not going to use car. It's not economical for them to bike. They don't need that equipment.

People like us, we need that equipment. Because there is only way we can travel from one place to another. We have desire to travel. The equipment needed is a car. Therefore, I'll buy a car. In the same way you are driven by your own vasanas, take another birth.

But in my case, there is no need for me. But I take birth by my own free will because I have a desire. And that is what Bhagavan has basically said. Why he takes that divine birth. He said, yada yada hi dharmasyagnanir Bhavati Bharata abyuthanam adharmashya tad atmanam srujami ham. The desire may be noble, it may be good or bad.

But unless there is desire, there cannot be any action swimming in Bhagavan's part also from Ishwara's point of view also he has a desire to set the creation right. When he sees that the Dharma is declining in his own creation, as we have seen in Vedantic discussions, then Bhagavan creates this universe out of his own self. The Creator is the efficient cause, knows how to create. He also knows how to maintain it. But the material he used to create this universe, his own self, he has created this universe out of his own self. So he is all pervading in this universe.

And he has created this universe out of his own will. Maya when he sees that his own creation, there is a decay of Dharma. Dharma we have seen in several discussions before is the law of being. That which makes a thing or a being what it is is its Dharma. If that Dharma is declining, a thing or being is not functioning as it should be, then it needs to be corrected. So here Bhagavan said, when in the society, just as an individual has a Dharma, the society also has a Dharma.

Human beings have their own Dharma. At the basic core level, a human being is a rational animal. He differentiated from all other animals as his reasoning power. So he can act rationally, he can think rationally. If human beings stop acting rationally, then Dharma is decayed. If they start acting irrationally, I will say Dharma is decayed for human beings, for that society.

So it's been current condition, the Dharma of democracy is that everyone has the right to vote or right to give opinion. When that Dharma is violated, then democracy is decayed and somebody has to come and correct it. So in this case, Bhagavan said, whenever there is a decay of Dharma, when I see that things are not performing as per Dharma, then it has to be replaced, corrected, and the order should be restored. So to give you an example from my own observation, a Dharma of a steel beam under a bridge is to provide the tensile strength to that bridge. Because that beam can bend and come back to its own position that the Dharma was steel. When the steel is corroded, it's still steel, but it's corroded steel.

That steel does not have the tensile strength which was required by that beam. And therefore it needs to be either repaired or replaced. So in that case, whoever is the owner of that bridge, responsible for that bridge, he may be paying no attention to that beam. But now that he has observed that the decay, there's a danger of breach to collapse. Well, he has to manifest himself as the corrector for that steel beam. So he said, yada yada, hi Dharma Siglanir Bhavati.

Whenever Dharma has decayed, that things or beings are not acting according to their own Dharma. Abhiuthana Madharma and the rise of Adharma Adharma, which is contrary to his own Dharma. Human beings are supposed to be rational. They are not acting rationally. They are no different than any other animals. Society has to be just.

If the society is not just, obviously it is not a society. If there is a chaos in the society, whoever is responsible for their society has to restore the order in the society. It becomes a just society again. Bhagawan said, that is my desire when I take birth by my free will. So we have seen that we are under the spell of Maya. Therefore, we are deluded by ignorance.

Ignorance is veiling my own self. I do not see who I am. I continue to change my vehicle from this body to another. But that's driven by my vasanas. For Ishwara in control of Maya. The whole creation is created by his own Maya out of his own self.

When he sees this creation, he is not performing as per his design. He has the desire to set it right. Paritranaya Sadhunam Vinashaya Chaduskritam, Dharma, Sansthapa, Narthaya, Sambhavami, Yuge Yuge. Time and again I manifest myself as one of my own creation and then set the order correct so that the things which are working as per Dharma are protected, and those which are not acting according to Dharma, they either to be corrected, rehabilitated, or replaced. So in the same example of my steel beam under a bridge, there are several steel beams under that bridge. Those are providing the tensile strength to that bridge.

People don't pay much attention. Corroded beams we see all the time. When we see extensive corrosion under that bridge, then whoever is in charge of that say, we need to do something. Well, let's figure out which beams we can restore and which we have to replace so that the overall strength of that bridge, by the collective strength of all the steel beams is restored back to where it should have been. Dharmasansthapa Narthaya for society to function as it was supposed to have functioned, as the just society, then I have to come and restore order, remove those who are poisonous, who cannot be rehabilitated, rehabilitate those who can be rehabilitated, so that those who are practicing Dharma are protected and society functions as it supposed to have functioned before the decay started. In verse nine, he says, Arjuna.

Here is another method Bhagavan gives us to achieve that state of knowledge that right now I am under the spell of Maya and my knowledge is veiled by my ignorance. And there are several other methods. We have seen Gina Yoga, Bhakti Yoga, Karma Yoga. He said that Karma Yoga, you can perform your actions as we have discussed, or you can just observe a divine person acting in this world selflessly and then recognizing how he does it in his divine manifestation, and then finding the same divinity within you. You will establish yourself in your own self, in your own real self, which is your own atma, your own consciousness. As we have discussed that there is nothing in this world which is not manifestation of Bhagavan, manifestation of Brahman.

And therefore you and I cannot be different from Avatara. So in our culture we have this Dasha Avatara, but actually that's just the popular version of it. There are Puranas, have 24 Avataras, some are 36 Avatara. Numerous descriptions of Avatara, because Avatara means the one that descend is Avatara. Avatarati ITI Avatara. You and I also have descended from our highest position of all knowing self to very limited knowing self.

From these limitations, I want liberation. Bhagavan said, even by observing others, so we create role models in our life, from them we learn. And if I can create the highest role model which has demonstrated how a person established in his own self acts in this world. Bhagawan said, you can also get liberated just by recognizing how a divine incarnation functions. Janma, Karma, Chame Divyam Evam yo Vittita tv. One who knows in essence what is the purpose of a divine Avatara and how that divine being functions in this world.

Therefore we learn Ramayana, therefore we recite Bhagavad Gita. We are trying to learn from them how Lord Rama acted in his life. If we can understand that Bhagavan says, Then when you give up this body. If I understood in my life how Rama has functioned in his life, what was his motivation to act the way he acted, what was Krishna's motivation to act the way he acted, then I will also find that same self in me by my own contemplation, my own observation of my own self, that this is not me. The demands of my body, my mind, intellect are not really me. I am something other than that.

Having understood this by learning from my own role models, when I give up this body, I don't have to take the birth again. So Swamiji explains here that in previous descriptions in scriptures, the idea was deathlessness. But then the later portion of our scriptures, the birthlessness is described. The death is obviously something to be afraid of. Therefore don't get infected by coronavirus or social distancing, all of that. But death is the one thing you are worried about.

But somehow we are going to die anyway if coronavirus or no coronavirus. But the very thought that I will start all over again. I have come all this far from going through learning from ABCD to whatever went through kg, then high school, then college, I have to start all over again.
snippets.reflection:
Today, look for 'action in inaction'—moments when apparent stillness conceals profound inner activity. And look for 'inaction in action'—moments when busy-ness masks inner stagnation.

Where in your life is genuine transformation happening? Where are you just going through the motions? The wise person sees beyond the surface appearance of action and inaction to the truth beneath.

Reflect on the teaching that God Himself works ceaselessly for the welfare of the world, though He has nothing to gain. What would it mean for you to work with that same spirit—fully engaged, yet free from personal agenda?

snippets.sanskrit:
वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिताः |

ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् |

ye yathā māṃ prapadyante tāṃstathaiva bhajāmyaham .

kāṅkṣantaḥ karmaṇāṃ siddhiṃ yajanta iha devatāḥ .
verseTranslations: Many have merged their existences in Mine, being freed from desire, fear and anger, filled always with Me and purified by the illuminating flame of self-abnegation.

snippets.commentary:
Chapter 4 Gnana Karma Sannyasi Yoga of Ending Karma in Knowledge. We all want to retire, but there is no real practical way to retire. You always do something. You can only retire mentally. So when you don't take your actions to be work, you retire, then you enjoy this. So when we change our mental attitude about our actions, then you retire from the actions.

So the only way Bhagavan says to end your actions because these actions are binding and I want to get out of this bondage. He said, you have to get rid of your actions. You have to retire from your actions. And the only way to retire is in the knowledge of who you are and what actions are all about. So in chapter three we have seen Karma Yoga and see how to gradually liberate yourself from your actions by changing your attitude towards actions. And now you say, well, how can I then completely relieve myself of this burden is to realize who I am.

So this chapter talks about what is the nature of the self. Ajaha Pisan Avya Yatman. I yourself, Ajaha Unborn, Avyatma, immutable, imperishable. That's the real nature of mind. Bhutanam Isvaropisan. I am the lord of all beings.

All beings are beings because of my presence in them. I am who I am and you are who you are. And the donkey is who donkey is. Because that life which is pulsating through them, the presence of that omnipresent self makes people who they are and beings who they are. That's why he is the lord of all the beings. Lordship is someone who has a control over my life is my lord in feudal system.

The guy who owned the estate was a lord. Even today he's a landlord and a renter. He has the control over your property. Therefore he's a landlord. So he is the Bhutana Mishurabeesan. Prakrutin swam this tyre.

You and I come into existence because of the Self. But because of the Maya we think we are individual egos, we are the individuals. But someone who has a complete identification with himself, he realizes this is just an appearance. It's just an illusion that I have taken a limited form. So the difference between us and the Avatar is we think we are limited. Avatar knows all the time.

His role in this life is limited. So Krishna can say, I am unlimited. He knew his role in this life, but he never bound himself with his role. He said that presiding over my prakriti, I come time and again to regulate Dharma. Hi Dharma Siglanir Bhavati. Dharma itself is a self regulating principle.

You don't really need to do anything about Dharma water. You don't have to train water to seek its own level because it's self regulating. My Dharma is also self regulating. So when I get out of my Dharma, I cease to be what I was. I'll become something else. When I came to this country, there were no jobs for architecture because I came in 82 and there was a recess in time.

So there were no jobs. So people said, Neil, the best thing you can do. And I was in Houston at the time, so the oil economy was still tail end of it. The best thing, if you can become a pipe designer, pipe drafting, pipe drafting. Pipe drafting is a lot of money. So compared to architecture, you do pipe drafting, all those pipes for the oil company, you will make more money.

And I said, no matter how much money there is, I won't be able to do it. That's my Dharma to design building. I can't design pipes. I may have to suffer through unemployment. As long as I don't get a job, I'll do something else. But by very nature, I'm an architect.

I have to design buildings. And then I finally somewhere I worked for some contractor. I think you will do very well if you continue in the contracting. I left the job right away. He is going to deviate me from my Dharma. So what is your Dharma if I stop being an architect or stop designing buildings?

I'm not an architect. It's as simple as that. So Dharma is a self regulating principle. To remain who I am, I have to remain in that Dharma. As soon as I deviate from that Dharma, Dharma itself, eliminate me from that existence, stop practicing architecture, I'll be eliminated from architectural societies, architectural communities, all the architectural duties and responsibilities. I'm not something else.

So Bhagwan says, yada yada, Hi Dharma Seglani R. Bhavati. In this world, the role is assigned to each things and beings. If they deviate from the Dharma, I will eliminate them. Regulating principle, some agency to do that, I will take Avatara. I will be a catalyst to make the change for those who are deviating from the Dharma. To eliminate from that society, that community, that part of this universe.

Abyutthanam, adharmasyatadhatmanam sujam. When there is a rise of Adharma, a lot of people are thinking that this is Dharma, but actually it's Adharma. So when that happens, when Dharma is misunderstood by beings and people, as the last time we have discussed, it's only for human beings because we have free will that we can deviate from our Dharma. We can be vegetarians and also can be non vegetarians. We don't know whether we were designed as vegetarians or not. Elephant knows he is designed as vegetarian.

Lion knows he is designed as carnivore. Because of our free will, we deviate from our Dharma when it becomes unbearable for the society. Swamiji used to say that you also, you know, surjami aham. During springtime, you see, when there are few weeds in your garden, you see, it's okay. You don't pay much attention to it. Then gradually your yard becomes filled with weeds.

Then less grass and more weeds. Then one Sunday, you put on your yard work clothes and say, I need to take care of this. You will tolerate it to a point. Let the weeds have good time. And then one Sunday you say, no, this is it or the protection of the grass. Vina Sahaja duskritam all the way.

So time and again you, as the Lord will come and set your yard right. Bhagawan said this, in my yard, I have to do the same thing. Paritra Naya Sadhunam Vinasaya. Somebody asked Swamijuman. They say, but if that's the case, why Bhagavan is not coming now? He said, Bhagavan clearly says Paritra Naya, Sadhuna.

If lesser evil is fighting with greater evil, Bhagavan has nothing to do with it. Let them figure it out how to kill each other. They will eliminate each other automatically. Bhagavan doesn't have to interfere. It is only that evil is not letting the good practice good. Then only Bhagavan comes.

In our case, it's a lesser evil fighting greater evil. It's still evil in the end. Therefore, he said, Bhagavan doesn't have to come yet. Dharma Sasthapanaarthaya. To establish Dharma again. As I said, it's a self regulating principle.

It will time and again it will reset Dharma so that the cycle will continue as it was designed. We take our car once in a while for tune up and wheel alignment. We tolerate it to a point. When it starts making noise while you're driving, I need to take it to the garage and calibrate it. So that is a self regulating principle to calibrate itself. Because time and again it gets out of its alignment.

And Bhagawan said, I as the self. I created this universe out of my own self, out of my own Maya. And I let it run through its own laws. The laws of nature are self regulating. So we don't have to control whatever the law of gravity and all that. We don't want to get up in the morning.

Let's make sure the law of gravity is working. Otherwise how I'm going to go down to the staircase. Because suddenly if I try to go down, I start flying into the ceiling. So I have to be very conscious that law of gravity is working every day. No, we don't have to. But my own behavior I have to regulate.

Because I have free will. I can be doing right. I also can be doing wrong. My free will is guided my mind and intellect and my mind and intellect can deceive me in doing something which is not right. I say I should not be doing this. But the mind will put an argument and say no.

Other people are doing it. So what's wrong in it then? Everybody's doing it. Cheating on 1040 because other people are doing it. I come to think that it's okay. But my conscience tell me it's not right.

But my mind and intellect will say that's okay. And that's what I suffer. So Bhagawan says, that's why I have to time and again rise in your own heart as your own inner voice. If I have few good thoughts which are still trying to direct me toward the right path, but many bad thoughts are avoiding me to exercise my right to follow the good thoughts, then that voice will rise in my heart. Because at least those good thoughts were propelling me to find what is right. So that's what Bhagawan said.

I will rise in your heart as your avatar. And that will redeem you from the Wrong that you are going to do, when will that happen? Janma Karma Chame Divyam evam yo Vidya Takvatah when you will realize that in its essence I am the divine being that this life is divine it given to me for learning to rise out of limitationswarjana. Once I realize what is the real truth, what is my real nature then when I get out of this existence when I exhaust all the vasanas and karmas of this existence I will not take the new Vasana. If last time I have experienced something and that was not really enjoyable I somehow suffered through that experience. But then what will I do next?

I don't want to go there again ever. Because I realized that this is a painful existence. It is when we go back and forth I enjoyed some but suffer some. So let me go for the enjoyment in the bargain I also suffer. So that's why we have Punarabi Janamam Punarapi Maranam because our attachments are taking us back to that existence Even though we suffered through it we forget at times that there will be sufferings also attached to this pleasures. So say but my divine nature is omnipresence and omnipotence he will get out of this Punarjunma.

So Tektvadeham Punarjunmati Saharjuna he comes to being my own self. So that technique now is given and we have discussed before the root cause is the attachment and its byproducts Raga, Bhaya and Krodha Raga is the root cause byproducts of Bhaya and Krodha Fear and anger are the byproduct. Once I realized that that's the root cause if I start getting out of attachment, Bhayana Krodha will not be there. He said therefore the goal is to get rid of attachment. But I can't get rid of attachment unless I take refuge in something higher. Say Maam Upa Sri Tah One who take refuge in me then me is the me the I I I keep reciting all my life.

If I take refuge in my I and do not rely on my body, mind and intellect to give me that peace and happiness which I am seeking then I will be liberated. Liberated from attachment. Once I liberate from attachment, I will liberate it from fear and anger. Bahavogna Tapasa Puta Madbhavam Agatha Again we have to be reminded Diwali you are not the guinea pig.

snippets.title: Day 60: Divine Knowledge
snippets.sanskrit:
चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागशः |

न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा |

एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभिः |
snippets.transliteration:
cāturvarṇyaṃ mayā sṛṣṭaṃ guṇakarmavibhāgaśaḥ .

na māṃ karmāṇi limpanti na me karmaphale spṛhā .

evaṃ jñātvā kṛtaṃ karma pūrvairapi mumukṣubhiḥ .
verseTranslations: The four divisions of society (the wise, the soldier, the merchant, the labourer) were created by Me, according to the natural distribution of Qualities and instincts. I am the author of them, though I Myself do no action, and am changeless.
My actions do not fetter Me, nor do I desire anything that they can bring. He who thus realises Me is not enslaved by action.
In the light of wisdom, our ancestors, who sought deliverance, performed their acts. Act thou also, as did our fathers of old.
snippets.commentary:
What is my purpose and destiny? We had been discussing chapter four, Vinana Karma Sannyasa Yoga, Yoga of Renunciation of accents in Knowledge. This is all about knowledge, all about what the real I is. So far in the chapter two and three saying that what I consider I is not I, but that which is permanent, that which is Ajaha, that which is immortal is me. But then chapter three talked about all the Karma Yoga that how do I act in this world and not get bound by those actions? The continuing that same theme that now how do I act in this world but not get bound by them is the theme of this chapter.

So the first thing Bhagavan says, Ajaha PI, I am unborn. He clarifies first that let's keep in mind that what's the theme of our discussion? Our theme of our discussion is from chapter two onward is I am unborn. Avya Yatma Immutable. There is no change ever takes place in the self. The supreme self which is all pervading.

Swamiji gives a commentary here that in the early part of Vedic literature there was a great emphasis on immortality. No death, deathlessness. He said that in the later part of this Vedic literature they switched on to Aja. Unbornness, birthlessness. So all of our stories about the Devas are looking for nectar Amrit. There is always a fear of death.

Over a period of time they realized it's not the death you should be worried about, it is the birth you should be worried about. As long as there is birth, there will be death. Only way you can overcome death is by not having birth. That's where it all started, because of my birth that I am now afraid of death. If I achieve the birthlessness, deathlessness I already achieved. So therefore Bhagavan clarifies very first declaration in this chapter is Ajaha Apisan, I am unborn.

No mutation ever takes place in myself. Now obviously Bhagavan is speaking from the highest perspective of the all pervading self. But we have also seen that our own self is no different than his self. This room space is no different than the space outside. Before this building was built, this space was nothing but the continuation of the space outside. I created this conditioning called walls, floor and ceiling.

Now the same space which is part of the universal space. And I consider it to be a room space. So all the qualities of the space outside still remains intact in the room space. Except in my perception, they're conditioned by this conditioning called walls, floor and ceiling. In my own existence, it is something similar. The self which is all pervading in my own self are exactly same.

The qualities attributed to the Supreme Self are also valid for my own self. So the first thing is Ajahapi son. I am unborn as the Supreme Self. Therefore my own self is also unborn. No mutation ever took place. Space never get contaminated by or affected by bad designs.

We design buildings, not all of them are good. So we jokingly say the doctors bury their mistakes. What do we architects do? We put it out there for the world to see every time we pass it. Who the heck designed this thing? But the space in a good building or a bad building are not affected by an architect's design.

It remains immutable, imperishable. This place was not brought from Hanover County. It will never be transported back to Hanover County. So he said, I am unborn. Therefore you are unborn. No mutation ever took place.

But Bhutanam Isvaropi son. But I am still the Lord of all the beings. Beings are beings because of my presence. And they are created out of my Maya. It is my Maya which created this universe out of my own self. There was no other material available to Bhagavan when he created this universe other than his own self.

But if you say there are other material existing, he is limited. He is no more unlimited. So if he is unlimited, you have to accept that there was no other material ever available to him to create this universe. And therefore the material he used to create this universe is nothing but his own self. That self, he says, is immutable. No change ever took place in it.

Only in your perception. Out of your ignorance. Out of my ignorance, I create my world and identify with this body, mind and intellectual. Just as we walk into this room, we identify this space with this room and say, this room is too low, Ceiling is not too good. Neeli should have made some ceiling or higher. Because we are affected by the conditioning, our perception affected by the conditioning.

Same way Bhagavan said that Bhutana mi swopishan. All beings are who they are because of my presence. This room exists because of room space. Just walls, floor and ceiling does not make the room. The heart of this room is the space in the room. Without space, there is no room.

Without self, there is no being. So Bhagavan said, I am Isvar. I am the Lord of all beings. However, this universe I have put forth according to its own dharma. Maya has its own Dharma. Sattvarajas and Tamas, those gunas and Dharmas are inherent in this universe.

And when there is a decay of this Dharma, when those Dharmas decline, I as the Creator, will set it back. I will participate actively in the creation. To set the creation back to as I design, time and again, we renovated my building. I designed something. After a while it gets deteriorated. We just change carpet in my front room.

Because when I designed in 2004, I had a perception what the room looks like. Over time, the carpet got soiled. I have to the architect again and say, change the carpet. Now it looks the way I have thought in my mind before. So Bhagawan said the same way, I come back again. Yadayadahi Dharma seglanir Bhavati.

When the essential Dharma of this universe gets out of line, then I take active participation. Just as I took active participation in creating this universe. I'll set the universe back to its Dharma. Paritra naya Sadhunam, Vina saya chaduskritam. Whatever went out of Dharma, I will eliminate. And then whatever is in line with Dharma and protect it.

So the Dharma principle will be restored. And as I said, Dharma is a self regulating principle. As soon as you get out of your Dharma, you lost your existence. As soon as sugar loses its sweetness. If you put sugar on frying pan and it becomes black, and now you put in your mouth, it's not sweet. It lost its existence because it's lost its Dharma.

You won't call it sugar anymore. So Bhagavan says, as soon as the Dharma gets out of line, the thing or being loses its existence. I destroy them by very fact that the Dharma is lost. So he said, therefore I come back again and again, every time. So I assure you that my creation will always remain as I have designed. The will of Dharma makes it function.

And then he said that every being still has to continue working. All beings who are working, they're working in my path alone. No matter what I am doing or you are doing, she is doing, he is doing, everybody is doing is because of that consciousness in them they are functioning because they are living beings, dead. Einstein cannot invent anything as long as they are alive, created, whatever. And whether I am going in the right direction or wrong direction in terms of what my goals are in life as long as I take the support of my consciousness it will allow me to go in the direction which I think is appropriate. That is because of the equipment that I have.

The equipment which I have will decide what direction I will take. My mind, my intellect, my body will determine what actions I am taking and what direction I will take. Whatever my desires are. Therefore Kanksutta Karmanam Siddhi Ijanti IHA Devataha. Because we want success in this life. We want success which is miserable success.

Something which I can show people and say this is what I did in last 4 years, 5 years, 10 years. So what we'll do is something. If say this is some pie in the sky type of a goal, I don't really pursue it. I want to pursue something which is I can show the result to the world. In this world getting results of your actions are easy and measurable and showable. Therefore Bhagavan says Kangsadha Karmanam Siddhi Ijanti Ihadvattaha.

Therefore we pursue those senses. Because I think I will get the results which I can enjoy. The whole goal I have is to enjoy the fruits of my actions. I do not want to perform any action which I already know. There is no result for it. If I know that I can keep working in this company and they won't ever promote me or will ever recognize my work.

What is a normal advice? You better leave this company or find someplace else which is I work and I get result. So my fruits of actions are driving me and by one side. Therefore people are pursuing different paths what they think will give them those results. My field is different than yours and your field is different than hers and hers is different than him. Next verse says Chaturvarnam Mayasrishtam guna Karma ha Vibhagashah Kartaram Aphima Vidhi kartaram Avyam.

This is not a social commentary on Indian caste system. This book was not written to have a commentary on whether a caste system is right or wrong. This book is a commentary about yourself. It's a self development book. Gita was not written for you to learn and then teach other people. Gita was designed for you to learn yourself and make progress.

Now I don't know why I am putting these efforts in this field and not Going in. Why did I go to architecture school? I should have been smart enough to figure out that time that I should be there. Medical or maybe some business or Wall street type of commerce. Nobody wanted to go in commerce. In my days, MBA wasn't even invented.

I think it was there but nobody knew. Nobody ever told me, Neil, you can be mba. So only three options. I had you become a doctor. That's your first choice. Second was a chemical engineer, the second choice.

And third, either electrical or civil engine. After that, no choice really. After that, Ba ba bcom no value. Nobody told me that if you go to Commerce, Neil, and become Wall street banker, you'll be much better off than becoming an architect. Why did you follow what you followed? Chaturvananyamaya Sristam Guna Karma Vibhaga Saha Looking at the mental moods of people, you can say that entire human race can be divided into four classifications.

And Bhagwan says I created them. I'm taking full responsibility. Don't think that it was by accident that people are different from each other. Guna Karma Vibhaga Sah. They need to be complementary. This society cannot function.

If all want to be architects, there won't be any clients. So if I want to play a cop and robber game, somebody has to be cop and somebody is a robber, right? To play the game, I have to have both characters. To make this universe function, I need to have all the ingredients needed for this universe. For make the human race function, I need to have all types of people will make the human society possible.

snippets.title: Day 61: Action in Inaction
snippets.sanskrit:
किं कर्म किमकर्मेति कवयोऽप्यत्र मोहिताः |

कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः |

कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः |
snippets.transliteration:
kiṃ karma kimakarmeti kavayo.apyatra mohitāḥ .

karmaṇo hyapi boddhavyaṃ boddhavyaṃ ca vikarmaṇaḥ .

karmaṇyakarma yaḥ paśyedakarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ .
verseTranslations: What is action and what is inaction? It is a question which has bewildered the wise. But I will declare unto thee the philosophy of action, and knowing it, thou shalt be free from evil.
It is necessary to consider what is right action, what is wrong action, and what is inaction, for mysterious is the law of action.
He who can see inaction in action, and action in inaction, is the wisest among men. He is a saint, even though he still acts.
snippets.commentary:
So we had been discussing chapter four, Vinana Karma Sannyasa Yoga Yunga of Renouncing Excellence and Knowledge. It's all about knowledge. It's all about Karma. It's all about knowledge. So the first thing we have seen in this where Bhagavan gave his identity, my nature is identical, that I'm unborn. And because his nature is Ajaha, the nature of myself is also Ajaha is unborn.

But as long as I am in this life, that will continue performing actions. So also I need to understand actions. Bhagavan said that this world is created by me and it is regulated by Dharma. It is regulated by the laws of nature that we know. The laws of nature have no exceptions and therefore they're self regulated. Nobody has to vouch over law of gravitation.

Nobody vouch over the laws of thermodynamics. And you can rely on them. Only time the people deviate from the Dharma is when they have free will. The human beings are the only one who have free will. So when they deviate from that Dharma, Bhagavan said, I manifest to make that Dharma aligned again. So we can say at the micro level, when I will deviate from my Dharma, the situation will teach me to come back to my Dharma.

You learn a lesson by your own actions, by your own situations. And then as long as there are good thoughts, as we have seen, it says Paritranaya Sadhunam Vinasaacha Duskrita. At the macro level, you can say the whole human society in micro level, when there are good thoughts, are overwhelmed by the bad thoughts in my mind. But one thing, as long as you hang on to the good thoughts, I will manifest in your mind and take care of all the bad thoughts so that the good thoughts will thrive and then you will be able to do what is right for you. Well then the question obviously occurred that why everyone cannot understand what is right and wrong. So Bhagavan said, because in this world, it is easier for us to find the results of our actions, so we pursue our senses and pursue deities of our senses.

In other words, we try to get success out of our actions. And that's miserable and enjoyable. I can see that I have done something and I got these results. So then we get more and more attached to those actions. That's where the problem starts. So the whole chapter is all about how to detach yourself from your own actions.

Therefore he said that this yoga I have taught to Vivaswan. And then he taught to Manu and the Manu taught to Eswaku. And thus all those Rajasis knew what is right, how to act in this world. So you are liberated. So you're not bound by your actions. But over a period of time that is lost.

So people are all got then attached to the actions. Everybody is trying to put more importance in what I have accomplished and achieved. And that's how you are judged by the society, by yourself. And they say that's what the problem is. So I'm teaching you this yoga which will liberate you from that. And then he said, obviously all people are not made equal.

Chatharuvanyam Maya Guna Karma, vi Pagisah that in any given society the people are four types. And as we discussed last time, no matter how hard you try, you will not be able to justify that. Bhagavan meant the four caste system universified. There are not four types of colors, Chatruvand. Four types of people of different colors I have created. So these were about the skin colors.

Obviously there are no four types of skin colors in our society. Or you can look at it this way. The colors are associated with Satvaraja and Tamas as white, red and black. And then they have added the yellow as the Vaishya. Then it's one of the commentary I have read says, okay, if that's the case, if it was a skin color, all whites are Brahmins, all red Indians are Kshatriyas, all Mongolis. People who are yellowish are Vaishyas and all dark people are Shudras.

That's not true either. So these are the colors of your mind. These are the colors of one's mental textures. See, the people in this world come with four different mental textures. And depending on the Guna and karma, they are divided into the four classification. Any given society at any given time that I am the author of them.

In other words, they exist because of me. But I'm not involved in. I didn't create them. They are by themselves have their own gunas and karmas. So even though I Act, I do not participate in that. As this self, as the supreme Self, there is no creation.

All exists is himself as one single entity. And therefore what is created is in perception only. So he said, even though I am the author of Jatir Vraniam, I am not the responsible party. And then we have seen that he said the Namaam Karmani limpanti Namay karmafulasproha. Why I am not attached to that? Because I am not Karma Falas proha.

You only get attached when you have Karma falasproha. From the self's perspective, he does not have anything to gain. So at macro level, the Bhagavan has nothing to achieve and therefore he has no desire. As long as you have no desire, you cannot be bound by it. At a micro level, all the desires are at my intellectual and mental level only myself is not participating in it. As the self, I'm completely detached from my actions.

So the actions are performed at the body level, are taught as the mind level desired at the intellectual and mental level. So these sufferers are also mind, body and intellect only. My actions are not right physical level, I suffer through physical level. At a mental level, I suffer through mind and suffer through intellect when they are wrong. But the self is not attached. Therefore the Namam Karmani Limpanti self is not affected by any actions, good, bad or ugly.

Just as our analogy of space, the quality of the space inside the room is exactly the same as outside the room. This space, no matter how I try to contaminate it, will not be affected and will not change its characteristics. Because it remains exactly same as the universal space outside. So myself in me is also in the same manner is not getting affected by my actions. Ithima yo Vijayanarti Karma Vihen NASA badhya. The one who knows this then my accents are only binding my body, mind and intellect.

Therefore the enjoyers and sufferers are nothing but the body, mind and intellect. At the ego level only, the self is not participating and not suffering. One who knows that Karma bhi NASA Badhyate actions do not bind them. Many people in the past, your ancestors knew this. And they continue to perform actions as required by their duties and the roles they've taken. But knowing that core of their being is not affected by these actions.

They lived very successful life and liberated themselves. And therefore I'm now advising you that you should also do this. Because one thing is clear. You cannot live without actions. Action is a signature of life. As long as you're alive, you have to perform actions.

When actions stop that's your death. Only in death you will be actionless. Action you must perform. But you need to change the attitude towards action. So you become actionless. You as the core of your being is not participating in these actions.

So you align yourself with the one which is not participating. Not align one which is fighting this battle. That's how you will become actionless. Goal is to become liberated from actions. One way to liberate from action is to become actionless. If I don't drive, Meena and I always argue you have a lot of traffic tickets.

Look at me, I've only got one or two. Compare the amount of miles I drive and compare the mile you drive. Then put a probability on every hundred thousand miles you drive or 10,000 how many tickets you got and how many tickets I got. So one way to not get a ticket is what? But you can avoid that. Because you can't come from your home to the class without driving.

So driving is unavoidable. So somehow you have to avoid getting tickets of other means. So action is unavoidable in life. So getting bound by the action is also unavoidable. But there may be other means to not getting attached is not identifying with the one who is acting. Then when you disown your relative who is doing something bad, you are no more attached to the actions.

As long as you are relating to that. I am part of that organization which is doing something wrong. You are bound by that. You detach yourself from that. You are just a witness now. So there must be another way of detaching ourselves from actions.

Our Sastra says there is a way. The concept Saksi Chaitanya. Just as when I am watching other people witnessing what other people are doing, I am not getting affected. Because I am just witness. You are doing some two people are fighting. I cannot be blamed for that fight the same.

If I start seeing my actions as a third party then I will not be bound by my actions. It's called Saksichaitanya. So the next verse says Kim Karma Kim Akarma IDHI kavayo ABHI atramo hita ha. And as Swami explains, even in our day to day life we call Kavi a poet as a Kavi in our vernacular languages. But Kavi with the name of a Rishi was a great Rishi who has written so many of these. You know Richas in Vedas.

So after that even the other Rishi, other people who are wise were also called Kavis so the Kavi became a connotation for a very wise person. So wise person is supposed to know what is right and what is wrong. But he says Karmas are so complex they wise people do not know what is action and what is inaction. They even get confused, deluded by that. See in this world if we can look at this relationship of cause and effect, everything in our universe works on cause and effect. So this universe is a very predictable universe.

There is nothing in this universe which cannot be predicted as long as you know all the factors which are acting on that action. So when you send the Mars, whatever the Yan as long as you calculate all the forces and act on that correctly and perfectly, it will land exactly as you plan. If you don't know one factor which is affecting it, you will not be able to predict where it is going to land. So if you know everything about how the actions are reacted by this world you will be able to predict what the results would be. Not very very difficult. But it is difficult to know how many things will affect my actions in this world.

I submit a proposal and I think I have done everything I know. So the result should be this. What I don't know is what the other people are doing, what their proposals would be like and therefore I cannot predict. Therefore I shouldn't be worried about what will come out of that. Therefore I said the nature of action in action is so complex because so many factors affect the result. They even get confused when they try to predict what will happen.

Tate Karma Pravakshami Therefore I am going to tell you what Karma is not Karma Phala I'm going to tell you.
