verseTranslations: As rivers in flood surge furiously to the ocean, so these heroes, the greatest among men, fling themselves into Thy flaming mouths.
As moths fly impetuously to the flame only to be killed, so these men rush into Thy mouths to court their own destruction.
Thou seemest to swallow up the worlds, to lap them in flame. Thy glory fills the universe. Thy fierce rays beat down upon it irresistibly.
snippets.commentary:
We have completed chapter 10, _Verses_ Yoga, and we'll be now discussing chapter 11, Vishwarupadarshan, the cosmic form of the Divine. So in last chapter, Arjuna had asked Krishna that tell me how I should feel your presence, the presence of the divine, presence of that all pervading self, then how I can meditate upon that. And in response to that, Bhagavan has given him the various examples of excellence in this world from various walks of life for Arjuna, which is also applicable to us, that from our day to day life, from our cultural backgrounds, from our spiritual quest, that we find examples all around us of excellence and feel Lord's presence. As we have discussed in chapter 10, that anytime I see excellence, my mind thinks it is the God's blessings, the grace of God, in other words, the divinity is evident in excellence. So Bhagavan has given various examples for Arjuna and say, when you see this, it will remind you of my presence in all things and beings. I'm not limited to those excellent manifestations, but that's where you will find it easier to experience my presence.

And now that Arjuna has heard that, he says that I'm not still experiencing that oneness, that oneness which you talk about all throughout this discourse. I have intellectually appreciated and I've come to the conclusion that that's what it is, that there is a one singular entity pervading this entire universe, which is you, the Supreme Self. But I need to have that experience. I would like to experience that oneness. This is something, as Swamiji explains, is similar to how we scientifically make any concept or a theory knowledge of our own. First I need to gather all the evidences and data.

And then once I have gathered all the data, all the evidences, that now I have to demonstrate that that phenomenon exists. I gather all information about how the water is formed. In chemistry classes, two molecules of hydrogen, one molecule of oxygen can create water. But at some point I want to see the demonstration so that in the lab I create that situation and Then see the demonstration how the hydrogen oxygen can create water in a similar fashion. Arjuna has now understood, but he wants to see a demonstration. So the chapter starts with Arjuna Vacha.

Arjuna said mat anugraha yaparamam guhyam adhyatma Sangnitam yat tvaya uktam vachasthena Moho ayam vigatomama. With your compassion for me, you have given me this secret knowledge. And as you have said, the that the self is indestructible, imperishable, one who consider himself to be the slayer or the slain in both cases is wrong. There is nothing to grieve over the changes which takes place in this world, including death. Because death is not the end of existence. It is only the existence in the form of this body.

So moho yam vigato Mama. By this discourse of yours. You have given me the secret knowledge. Bhavapyayohibhutanam srutao vistarsomaya totta Kamal patraksa mahatmya API cha vyayam. And I have also heard the origin and destruction of beings, O lotusaid Krishna from you and also your inexhaustible greatness. I heard the greatness of the self, the supreme Brahman, that which is not limited by anything.

And therefore my delusion is gone. I understand it clearly now. Evam etat yatha attha tvam atmanam parameshwara jastumi chami the rupam aishwaram purushottamam. However, I would like to see. Form as you described yourself of that oneness in this world of plurality. I have understood that you pervade the entire universe and therefore there is no existence separate from you.

However, at this time I cannot see that. And I would like to see that. I would like to experience that oneness of yours. Manyase yaditatsakyam maya drastum ITI prabhav. If you think it is possible for me to see that divine form, then, O Lord of Yogas, show me you are that imperishable form which includes everything in this world. I would like to see that complete form of yours where everything is in yourself.

It is easier for me to see your presence in this world of plurality. As Swamiji explains that it is easier for me to see gold in gold jewelry. I can take one look at it, experience it, the gold in it, I can pick up the another one as long as it is the excellence. In other words, the gold is apparent. It's not covered by something. The gold is manifested in the jewelry.

I can see the gold in it. So it is easier to see the divinity in the world of plurality for us. What is not possible for us generally is seeing all the plurality in that one single entity. I can imagine that God is in you. God is in me, God is in He, God is in she. If my mind and intellect has achieved that level of purity, level of understanding, then I start seeing the divinity in all beings.

And therefore, in our culture, when we meet each other, we say, namaste, Namah te, I bow down to you. I'm not bowing down to the limited self which is standing in front of me. Because I may have my own opinion about that person, but I still do. Namaste to all of the people I meet, at least culturally. That's what we should be doing or we are doing. Who we are bowing down to is the divinity in that person that I recognize.

The divinity in me and divinity in you is the same. So I respect the divinity in you. I bow down to you with that recognition. My transaction with you would be always of very friendly, very congenial, and not adversarial. Because I have recognized that myself and yourself has one thing in common, that consciousness, the divinity which makes me who I am. The same divinity, the same consciousness is within you.

What I have trouble imagining or trouble perceiving or trouble seeing is the whole divinity is one. And you and I in them. And we have heard in Bhagavad Gita before, Bhagavan says, I am not in them, they are in me. The car is in the space, the space is not in the car. When I see a car which was built in Germany, there was space inside. When it was in Germany, there was German space.

And they seal it tight and then transport that car to United States. Now the car is here, the space is still intact which was sealed in Germany. Now, whether the space now in the United States is the German space or American space in the car, obviously the answer is simple. The space inside the car is American space. So what happened to the German space which was in the car when it was still tight in Germany? The answer obviously is in our way of seeing space.

As long as I see the space in the car, I have difficulty imagining what happening to that space which was German space. When it came to America, the space was inside the car. Car was never opened till it came here. Well, it should have been a German space in it. But if I start seeing that the space was not in the car, the car was in the space, then I do not have any difficulty. Car was traveling in the space.

And therefore wherever the car is, that country space is in that car, because car is traveling in the space. For me to imagine that, I have to first have a perception of a space as a totality without any gap. A German space is one space, an American space is another space, I will have difficulty. But if I can imagine a homogeneous, continuous, universal space, now I can see everything is in it. So what you and I have difficulty in recognizing the unity between myself and yourself and herself, and also the objects in this room is because of the distance between us. I am here and you are there, you are there and she is somewhere else.

What is separating us from each other is the space. What is separating me from my father is the time. My father lived up to 1975 and I'm here today in 2014 thinking about it. So we are separated from each other by time. So there are two things which creates this world of plurality for me, and that is space and time. We have also heard from sages and scientists that this concept of space and this concept of time is creation of my mind.

So one can say, well, what is the distance between here to D.C. and so on. So it's too long a journey. And somebody will say it's too close, it's only two hour drive. So my mind creates the valuation whether it's too far or too little, that the conception of space in my mind, same thing. If somebody says I'll be back in half an hour, well, is it too soon for me or too long for me? I can't wait for half an hour.

You need to be back here in 10 minutes. Because my conception of time is different than his conception of time. For him half an hour is too short, and for me half an hour is too long. Well, anytime somebody goes to India for a vacation and when they come back, and if I ask that person, so how was your vacation? The answer is it was great, but it was too short. And I say, how long were you there?

He said four weeks for me, too long a time. I only go there for a week or two. So for me a two weeks vacation is good enough for them four weeks is too short, because when you are enjoying their four weeks seems too short. But if you were suffering because of the heat or monsoon and all the other things which we normally complain about, if I'm suffering. I'll say, boy, it was too long when I tried. And then I finally was ready to get out.

So even time is a concept of my mind. If these two concepts of my mind are wiped out, then I will see the world completely differently. If the concept of space is wiped out from my mind, then I will see you and I and everyone in this room come together as one entity. There is no space between us. We are all joined together and we will be one entity with different limbs, but we are all together. Swamiji uses a very good analogy in his commentary.

There is a toy maker making toys from clay. And he has various toys and various dolls. Elephant, tiger, baby and a bird. And then he decided, no, this is not good. I need to use this clay for something much larger, more sellable. He takes all those dolls and compresses them into one ball of clay.

And when he compressed them together, what he has done is taken all the space away from each other. Previously they were sitting on a table or in a display box as separate entity. Once he gathers them and lumps them into one. And now a big lump of clay. At the same time, I can see the face of the elephant on that surface of that lump. Also see the baby smile.

Also see the tiger's face. What is taken away from each other is the space. The same way the events in my life has a time value of it was in my past, or it is in my present, or it will be in my future. My childhood is in my past. My youth is in my past. My old age is in my present.
snippets.reflection:
Sit for a moment with the vastness of existence—billions of stars, billions of years, billions of beings. Let yourself feel small in the face of it all.

Then remember: you are not separate from this vastness. You are the universe looking at itself. Both the terror and the wonder are appropriate responses to ultimate reality.

The cosmic vision shows that time devours all things. What would change if you held this truth constantly in awareness? Would petty concerns still trouble you? Would you use your time differently?

snippets.title: Day 152: Arjuna's Terror
snippets.sanskrit:
आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो

श्रीभगवानुवाच |

तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व
snippets.transliteration:
ākhyāhi me ko bhavānugrarūpo namo.astu te devavara prasīda .

śrībhagavānuvāca .

tasmāttvamuttiṣṭha yaśo labhasva jitvā śatrūn bhuṅkṣva rājyaṃ samṛddham .
verseTranslations: Tell me then who Thou art, that wearest this dreadful Form? I bow before Thee, O Mighty One! Have mercy, I pray, and let me see Thee as Thou wert at first. I do not know what Thou intendest.

Lord Shri Krishna replied: I have shown myself to thee as the Destroyer who lays waste the world and whose purpose is destruction. In spite of thy efforts, all these warriors gathered for battle shall not escape death.
Then gird up thy loins and conquer. Subdue thy foes and enjoy the kingdom in prosperity. I have already doomed them. Be thou my instrument, Arjuna!
snippets.commentary:
What is my purpose and destiny? We had been discussing chapter 11 in October 30th. We have seen Arjuna's description of what he is saying and we have discussed so many times in last few weeks. What he has seen is everything that he can perceive in this world, all coming together as one, this plurality which is separated from each other. Now he sees that as one singularity. He also sees all the divine beings which he has just heard of in his Vedic training or from the cultural training.

He see all of them, the Brahma, Vishnu, Mahesh, all of them into this one entity. But he also sees that all these beings are rushing towards the mouth of that supreme being and getting dissolved into that getting, disappearing into it. And he comes to this realization that just as the river water is rushing towards the ocean, it like intuitively with inherent nature, not that somebody is propelling it, somebody forcing it by its inherent nature. The river water runs from the mountaintops through the plains to the ocean. Just as the moth instinctively rush towards its death into the flame, river rushes towards the ocean, loses its identity. Mighty river, like Ganges or Yamuna or even Patomak or James, once it disappears into the ocean, there is no identity of the river of its own.

It just becomes part of the ocean. It seemed that the true nature of the river and the moth. So he sees that all the beings are without any hesitation, they're rushing towards the mouth of this great being and disappearing into it. And then he sees that this great being is seemingly enjoying this act of all these beings disappearing into his mouth, some get stuck. He makes sure that nobody is left out when we do some task. And we are so happy about it, that we are so proud of that.

In the end we try to inspect and say, is there anything left? That's basically equivalent to licking what's going into his mouth. See, make sure that all these beings are getting dissolved into his own being. And now Arjuna says, I don't understand any of this. Akyahi me ko bhavan ugrarupaha. Tell me O being with a very fierce form Namostu te deva or prasida if you want to ask somebody who are you and that person is not smaller than you are, you better be a little respectful first.

It does ask and say I want to know who you are. But Namostute devara prasida, you are the supreme Lord. So I bow down to you and have mercy on me because I don't understand. I am not capable of understanding who you are and vignatum ichami bhavantam adyam I have completely and clearly recognized that you are the Adi being. You are the original being. All beings are nothing but the manifestation of you.

They come from you, they go into you. But you are that original Bhavantam adyam. You are that original being. Vigna dummy Charming. I want to know which is in normal terms we say I want to know God. I know he is the supreme being.

At least from my childhood religious training I understood that he controlled this world. Vigna tam ichami bhavanta madhyam Even after having this global vision, the cosmic vision our intellect is not capable of understanding it. Nahi prajanami tavapravratyam Also I have no idea why you are doing this activity which I see right now. Isn't that something we ask all the time? I don't know why Bhagawan does this thing, why there is tsunami, why there is earthquake or why Bill Gates and Steve Jobs is successful and not every IT person in this country. I do not know what you are doing Bhagwan.

I hope you know what you are doing. Basically Arjuna puts it in his word very respectfully saying I want to know you O supreme Being. I clearly recognize you are the original being But I also don't understand what you are engaged into right now I see all this being going into your mouth and getting crushed. He has also seen we have seen that all Kauravas are going to into his mouth as well as all the great kings on both sides. See anytime we have a reason, we have a reason which is something closer to our own situation. Anytime you have a dream, dream is always something related to what I was thinking about last probably a week or so.

So even when he sees this whole cosmic reason he focuses on all these Kauravas are going into his mouth. All the kings from the Kauravas as well as the kings from our side going into his mouth they said I don't understand what are you engaged into it right now. And in response to that the Bhagavan Said Kalav asmi. I am time Lokaksha, Kruta Pravrad daha. I am engaged in destroying this world. I can see the world from both perspectives.

Either I can see it from a constructive perspective or a destructive perspective in nature. Actually both simultaneously keeps going on. Something gets destroyed, something gets built. I can fix my perspective only on the destruction part and say why this thing is happening. I can look at the statistics in the newspaper and say how many people die every day and say oh God, billions of people die. I don't know whether millions or billions, but I'm sure there are plenty because every several seconds there's somebody dies in the United States.

I read somewhere if I look and say God, why do you do this? This many people dying every day. Don't you have better things to do than just killing? Right now Arjuna is just seeing this destruction going on. So Bhagavan's answer is also exactly that. Kalaha Asmi, I am all devouring time.

I was born in 1948, in 2012. I'm an old man, but sometimes in 2000 something I won't be around. Lokakshaya krita pravadha. You're seeing me destroying this world. As you know, the world as I know right now, is actually rushing towards its own destruction. All my friends and relatives and all of them, one after the other, they're all rushing towards their own death.

Kalavasmi lokaksha Kruta Prabhradha. From your perspective, Arjuna, I am that all devouring time. Right now what you are seeing is I am engaged in destroying these worlds. Lokan sama hartum iha pravrutaha ruteapi tvamna Bhavishyanti swarve e avasthitaha pratyanikeshi odaha. Even without you now coming down very personally to Arjuna, Arjuna said, I don't want to engage in this war. The whole purpose of this divine vision Arjuna wanted to have was all this philosophy you have given me in the argument in the second chapter in the beginning that why I should engage in this war because Bhagavan said, look, whoever takes birth will die.

Beginning they unmanifest, they will manifest for a while, they will unmanifest in the end. So you don't worry about it. Whatever the little role you are given in this drama, you take part and take credit for it and you don't worry about who's going to die and who's going to survive. But Arjuna was not clear. So he said, well let me see this entire vision now. He sees the entire vision and then he says I don't understand what are you doing?

And Bhagawan basically said, don't worry about it, I am time. I'm going to destroy everything in time. Whether you take part in it or not. Even without you, none of the warriors in front of you shall live. Whether you take part in this war or not is immaterial. Their destiny is to die in time.

Whenever their time will come, they will die. Because I am that all devouring time. Tasmat Utestha Yashola Basva all you have to do is take credit for it. Everybody says Bill Clinton was the best president in his time. We all thrived and our country has this surplus we never had seen in all these times before. And George Bush came and completely messed it all up.

But I'll tell you what, if George Bush was the president at the time when the technology bubble was blowing up, he would have the same credit. He just happened to be at that time a president. And we can blame Obama all we want. About 8% or 9% unemployment. But even if Bill Clinton is today, he would have the same problem. Because this thing is driven by this cycle, cosmic cycle, economic cycles, whatever the cycle you want to call it, you just happen to be there.

And if you're a smart person, you do your part and take credit. Become that instrument in this giant will of Dharma. So therefore Bhagavan said, look, all these people are already killed by me. Without your help also they will get killed. You just saw that every being is rushing towards their death in my mouth. Get up Yashola Basra and get the fame that you deserve.

Jitva Satrun Bhangshvarajam Samruddham get victory over your enemies and enjoy the kingdom. Maya Evey Thai Nihitaha Purva Meva. I have already killed all these people before you decided to start this war. Nimittamatram Bhava Savya Sachin. So you just become the Nimitta Matra. If somebody gives you credit and say why don't you become our group's leader and do this petition to such and such.

It's not that the guy who is making a petition is the only guy who came up with the idea or we are just giving him a credit. Look we can all go and talk. You become our leader. Arjuna, I'm just giving you this opportunity. To become the Nimitt Matra because you deserve it. We always choose a person who has the best capabilities or the best qualification to become the representative of our group.

We try to elect the best person who could be our president by looking at his qualifications. So becoming a Nimitta mantra is also is something to be very proud of. That somebody has given us a chance considering us to be worthy of it. So when Bhagavan said, you become Nimitta Matra for something, you should take great pride in it and get up and do it. Swamiji says, in this case it Arjuna. But in our case also we get this chance all the time.

Bhagavan gives us the ability, capability and opportunity to do something in at our level in this world. And Bhagavan saying the same thing, look, I have already done this thing. It will be done whether you take part in it or not. But you have this opportunity. Why don't you take this chant and become Nimitta Matra? Become the instrument in my hand and take the credit and enjoy the credit.

Bhagavan said to Arjuna, same thing. These people are killed. You just do your part. You had been trained for these wars, tend up for the right cause. Take your credit and enjoy the fruits. Dronam Chabism Cha Jayadratham cha Karnam Tatha Anyanabi Yodavira Maya Hatam Stumhi Jahimam Vyatista.

Nobody gives us this kind of, you know, guarantees before we start anything. Neil, go and do this. You are going to win it. Don't worry about it. I already taken care of it. Once in a while somebody does it for us too.

Our father comes to him and says beta, don't worry about it. I already talked to him. They are going to hire you, Right? So Bhagavan said, look, you are worried about the few of them. Whether you admit it or not that I can fight all this battle. But how can I fight in front of this great warriors such as Drona, Bisma, Jayadrata and Karna?

Bhagavan specifically mentions them and says I have already killed them.

Whenever their time will come, they will die. Because I am that all devouring time. Tasmat Utestha Yashola Basva all you have to do is take credit for it. Everybody says Bill Clinton was the best president in his time. We all thrived and our country has this surplus we never had seen in all these times before. And George Bush came and completely messed it all up.

But I'll tell you what, if George Bush was the president at the time when the technology bubble was blowing up, he would have the same credit. He just happened to be at that time a president. And we can blame Obama all we want. About 8% or 9% unemployment. But even if Bill Clinton is today, he would have the same problem. Because this thing is driven by this cycle, cosmic cycle, economic cycles, whatever the cycle you want to call it, you just happen to be there.

And if you're a smart person, you do your part and take credit. Become that instrument in this giant will of Dharma. So therefore Bhagavan said, look, all these people are already killed by me. Without your help also they will get killed. You just saw that every being is rushing towards their death in my mouth. Get up Yashola Basra and get the fame that you deserve.

Jitva Satrun Bhangshvarajam Samruddham get victory over your enemies and enjoy the kingdom. Maya Evey Thai Nihitaha Purva Meva. I have already killed all these people before you decided to start this war. Nimittamatram Bhava Savya Sachin. So you just become the Nimitta Matra. If somebody gives you credit and say why don't you become our group's leader and do this petition to such and such.

It's not that the guy who is making a petition is the only guy who came up with the idea or we are just giving him a credit. Look we can all go and talk. You become our leader. Arjuna, I'm just giving you this opportunity. To become the Nimitt Matra because you deserve it. We always choose a person who has the best capabilities or the best qualification to become the representative of our group.

We try to elect the best person who could be our president by looking at his qualifications. So becoming a Nimitta mantra is also is something to be very proud of. That somebody has given us a chance considering us to be worthy of it. So when Bhagavan said, you become Nimitta Matra for something, you should take great pride in it and get up and do it. Swamiji says, in this case it Arjuna. But in our case also we get this chance all the time.

Bhagavan gives us the ability, capability and opportunity to do something in at our level in this world. And Bhagavan saying the same thing, look, I have already done this thing. It will be done whether you take part in it or not. But you have this opportunity. Why don't you take this chant and become Nimitta Matra? Become the instrument in my hand and take the credit and enjoy the credit.

Bhagavan said to Arjuna, same thing. These people are killed. You just do your part. You had been trained for these wars, tend up for the right cause. Take your credit and enjoy the fruits. Dronam Chabism Cha Jayadratham cha Karnam Tatha Anyanabi Yodavira Maya Hatam Stumhi Jahimam Vyatista.

Nobody gives us this kind of, you know, guarantees before we start anything. Neil, go and do this. You are going to win it. Don't worry about it. I already taken care of it. Once in a while somebody does it for us too.

Our father comes to him and says beta, don't worry about it. I already talked to him. They are going to hire you, Right? So Bhagavan said, look, you are worried about the few of them. Whether you admit it or not that I can fight all this battle. But how can I fight in front of this great warriors such as Drona, Bisma, Jayadrata and Karna?

Bhagavan specifically mentions them and says I have already killed them.

snippets.title: Day 154: The Cosmic Form
snippets.sanskrit:
कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन्

त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणस्-

वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः
snippets.transliteration:
kasmācca te na nameranmahātman garīyase brahmaṇo.apyādikartre .

tvamādidevaḥ puruṣaḥ purāṇasa- tvamasya viśvasya paraṃ nidhānam .

vāyuryamo.agnirvaruṇaḥ śaśāṅkaḥ prajāpatistvaṃ prapitāmahaśca .
verseTranslations: How should they do otherwise? O Thou Supremest Self, greater than the Powers of creation, the First Cause, Infinite, the Lord of Lords, the Home of the universe, Imperishable, Being and Not-Being, yet transcending both.
Thou art the Primal God, the Ancient, the Supreme Abode of this universe, the Knower, the Knowledge and the Final Home. Thou fillest everything. Thy form is infinite.

Thou art the Wind, Thou art Death, Thou art the Fire, the Water, the Moon, the Father and the Grandfather. Honour and glory to Thee a thousand and a thousand times! Again and again, salutation be to Thee, O my Lord!
snippets.commentary:
We had been discussing Chapter 11, Viswarupadarshan Yoga of the Cosmic form of the Lord. We have seen so far that Arjuna learned from Bhagavan first the nature of the limited self. What is the nature of this conditioned self? And learned that the self is immortal. The conditionings are perishable. Conditionings are this body, this mind, this intellect are perishable.

But the self is imperishable. And therefore, while working in this world, keep that self in mind, identify with that self. But that is not very naturally happening to people. So Bhagavan talked about how to act in this world, addressed Arjuna, that you should act in this world in the spirit of Yajna. You will be then gradually detach yourself from this ego and will be able to identify with yourself. So then obviously Arjuna wanted to know the nature of that imperishable self.

So from chapter seven, Bhagavan said that I am the source of all the beings and things. Aham krutnasya jagadah prabhavaha pralayah t. I am the source and dissolution of all things and beings in this world. So that's my relationship to you. I am the source of all the beings, and therefore also I am the source of you also. And then he says, matthaha parataram na asti kincit anyat asti dhananjaya. There is nothing higher than me.

There is nothing higher than this self. Therefore you should identify with the self. But Arjuna obviously was not ready to take this on its face value. The Bhagavan said, I am the source of all the beings and all the things. He wanted to know more. So he said, I want to know in detail your glories.

Because he is still identifying with Krishna as Krishna, him as Arjuna. And how can he be the Lord of all the beings? Arjuna identifying with his limited self, is speaking from his ego's perspective and projecting his world. Krishna speaking from his identification with the Supreme. He said, I am the source of all the beings so Arjuna said, explain to me in detail because I actually love hearing from your great glories all powers of this omnipresent omniscient being. So in chapter 10 we have detailed description of Bhagavan saying that you can see my glory in everything that is splendid, wonderful, strong, anything where you can find something which catches your eye.

That's me at the core of all beings. I am the sweetness in sugar, I am the light in sun, I am the liquidity in water. And even he says Dyutam, Chalaya, Tamasmi, even I am the gambling and the fraudulence. Even that also somebody can only cheat you if he is alive and conscious and consciousness is working through him. Everything that you see in this world, the core of all beings and things, is me and me alone. Nothing other than me exists.

Arjun heard all that, but he's still not satisfied. He's still not grasping the whole idea of the omnisciency and omnipotency of the Lord that how Lord can be everywhere. Say I want to see it. I have no doubt you said this and also many others have said before you. So I have no doubt about it. I take it for granted that what you are saying is correct.

Because time and again the sages after sages from the generations who come and confirm that this is the truth. So therefore I am not doubting it now. You, Krishna, telling me so, I have no doubt, but I want to say it. And therefore in chapter 11 we see that Krishna grants him this great vision of totality that you can see all at once. The past, present and future, an entire universe in your one glimpse, you can see it. And what he sees is that up till now the things which he has been seeing as different entities are all merged into one.

They're all _part of the one entity. Therefore he describes and says that I'm seeing that you have thousands of mouths and thousands of hands and thousands of legs and thousands of stomachs. Because every stomach is yours, every hand is yours, every mouth is yours. So I see now all of them as _part of the one entity. I'm seeing the wonderful sights and I'm seeing all these forms and colors and all the deities, the things which I have not seen before, I have not even imagined before. I'm seeing all of them.

So he's enchanted by that form. But then he sees the other side of it. Other side of creation is always destruction. This is the other side of it. He sees that now all those beings which I see existing in him also rushing towards his mouth to get destroyed. Every name and form in this world is helplessly rushing toward its own destruction within the self which is supporting it.

So he starts getting really nervous about it that everyone is rushing towards your mouth to get destroyed. And I see the great people, the great heroes are helplessly rushing towards your mouth and getting destroyed. And that reason really terrified him. We had this notion about Bhagavan as one who is compassionate. He is serene and he is creative. But the destructive aspect, we never focus on Arjuna while listening to all the discourses before all the glories, all the splendid descriptions given.

I am the light in the sun. I am the fragrance in flower. So he was expecting it will be all well and good. Once I see the totality, it will be wonderful. My mind will be at peace. And after that there will be no problem.

But he sees the other side of it. He says everything is getting destroyed. Every name and form is getting destroyed in the being of that great Mahatma, the great person, the Purusha, the one entity. So he says, I'm terrified. I can't find my place in life. I don't know where I am and I'm losing my bearing.

So tell me, who are you and what are you up to? Because I have never imagined your form like this. See, only in our culture, in our religion, we have terrible forms of God also. Kali and Shiva, doing Tanda and Rythya and Pralaya. But most cases we want to see him as very calm and serene and very peaceful God. But when you want to understand God in totality Bhagavan said, you have to know this also.

So he sees this destruction happening. Bhagavan says, I am the world devouring time. Kalaha asked me that I am that time which devours everything. Within the time, all names and forms will be destroyed. Everything dissolves into time. Things exist in time, get destroyed by time.

It's I am that I am that all devouring time. What you are seeing me right now is my form which devours all names and forms. What are you up to right now? I'm engaged in destroying the world as you know. The world as you and I know is already getting destroyed by Bhagavan. Every second, every millisecond, it's constantly getting destroyed.

My reality yesterday is no longer my reality today. My reality today will no longer be my reality tomorrow. So it's constant, constantly destroying my world. And I am on the other end, constantly trying to keep my world in a status quo. I want to keep it exactly as I like. I think I'm right now in a better situation.

Let's keep it that way. So we have a tug of war between the Bhagavan and I. I try to keep it. He wants to destroy it. So when I see him as all destroying powers of Bhagwan, why are you doing this? They say my purpose is. I am the time who devours everything.

And right now you are seeing me destroying the world. As you know, and directly addressing. Arjuna said you were afraid that you will kill all these people. You thought that you are so powerful that you will kill all these people. Therefore you were afraid of taking _part in this war. They said, I have already killed them all.

From our perspective, we are all alive and trying to survive. But Pagwan says there's time. I have already killed all of you for whatever time it is. You are going to be killed by time. No matter how many cryogenic Linux opens in Richmond. There is one opened, I guess, recently.

The time may be in years, maybe in millennials or years. But you will be destroyed by time. I've already destroyed you as the name and form you exist. I already killed you. Whether you take _part in this game or not. You think that you don't want to take _part in destroying these people?

These people already destroyed because we learned. I told you before, what will get destroyed is the conditioning. Only this self is immaculate, permanent, without any limitations. So these people are already destroyed as they exist. Is they Karna and a Bhishma and a Jayadratha. Even though they seem invincible from your perspective, and they have powers so much greater than you are.

But they are killed by me. So my advice to you, Arjuna, is take charge of your life. Do what you were trained to do. Do what you thought was the purpose of your life. To establish the rule of justice and punish the people who are evil doers. I have already killed them.

You take the credit and then enjoy this kingdom. And that's where Bhagavan stopped. And then Sanjaya now takes a chance to tell Dhritarashtra what's happening. Sanjaya Vacha etatshrutva vachanam KE sa vasya Krutanjalir vaipamanaha Kiriti namaskritva Bhuya evaha Krishnam Sagad Gyadam Bhite Bhitaha Pranamya. He's just giving him what's happening, a running commentary. And he said Having heard these words from Krishna.

That I already killed all of them. I am the one who devours everything. I am the one who kills. You just take the credit and enjoy the victory. Only you can take credit or enjoy victory if you take _part in it. If I don't take _part, there is no chance.

There is 100% chance of me losing if I don't buy a lottery ticket. Guaranteed 100% chance of not winning the lottery. That's at least the surest outcome I can say. But if I think I have a chance to win 1 in 10 million, I have to buy a lottery ticket. I have to take _part in it. The so Bhagawan said, I already decided who the winner is.

You go ahead and buy a lottery ticket if you think you can. But if you don't take _part, you will have no chance to win this thing. So Arjuna, therefore get up and do your duty. Result is decided by me. But you have a duty to perform your actions for which you are trained, which you thought is purpose of your life. And you must pursue that.

Having heard this, Sanjaya said that this Kiriti crowned one Gutanjali Rwpamanha, his folded palms trembling because he is still shaken up by this vision of all death and destruction happening constantly in this great self. The self remaining what it is, the names and forms are created in and getting destroyed all the time. Namaskritva having prostrating to him Bhuya Eva Aha Krishnam. He said the following words. He is choked with emotions, choked with the realization that what the self is all about. Up till now I was in control of my life.

I thought I can control it. I have accomplished things. I have acquired abilities and promises. I suddenly realized that those things are of no value unless there is a support from the Almighty. The consciousness functioning through me. I may be the best architect, but if I'm in a coma, it doesn't do any good to anybody.

सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं

यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि
snippets.transliteration:
namaḥ purastādatha pṛṣṭhataste namo.astu te sarvata eva sarva .

sakheti matvā prasabhaṃ yaduktaṃ he kṛṣṇa he yādava he sakheti .

yaccāvahāsārthamasatkṛto.asi vihāraśayyāsanabhojaneṣu .
verseTranslations: Salutations to Thee in front and on every side, Thou who encompasseth me round about. Thy power is infinite; Thy majesty immeasurable; thou upholdest all things; yea,Thou Thyself art All.
Whatever I have said unto Thee in rashness, taking Thee only for a friend and addressing Thee as O Krishna! O Yadava! O Friend!' in thoughtless familiarity, no understanding Thy greatness;
Whatever insult I have offered to Thee in jest, in sport or in repose, in conversation or at the banquet, alone or in a multitude, I ask Thy forgiveness for them all, O Thou Who art without an equal!
snippets.commentary:
As we have been discussing last few times, that now that Arjuna has seen this cosmic form of the Lord, in other words, his mind has comprehended the unity of this plurality, this world which seemingly is divided among this plurality of things and beings, is actually strung by the same entity which manifests as this plurality, beings and things come out of the same reality and dissolve into the same reality. That reality is what he's facing right now. So he's now offering his prayer, his adoration to that. And he has said, you are everything, Vayu Yama, Agni, Varuna, Anything that I can think of, any being my mind can perceive, is nothing, but you alone, all I see in you. And therefore he says, my salutations to you, my salutations to you thousand times I salute you from your front, I salute you in your back, I salute you in your side, because you are everywhere. Wherever I turn around, I see you.

If we come to the conclusion this world is nothing but the Lord's manifesto, so obviously when we turn around, we see him just as this classical. Maybe it's a folklore, but that Nanak went to Kaaba and he was sleeping with his feet towards Kaaba. And the Maulvi comes and says, you idiot, what are you doing? He said, oh, is that what I'm doing? Well, then move my leg to where the Kaaba is not the moulv in anger moves his leg. Wherever he turns, he sees Kaaba moving around with it.

So basically saying God is everywhere, because God is everything, therefore God is everywhere. So he said, therefore. Now, whatever I see when I say I bow down in the front, in the back and the rear, whatever I see in front of me, whatever I see in the side of me is nothing. But you and I recognize that in our culture we say, namaste, Namahte, I bow down to you, not you as a person, you the self, which is no other than myself. Once we found that commonality, we obviously can't have animosity or jealousy, for we just give lip service. Namaste, we Never understood.

So obviously we don't get the benefit of that. But if we develop any commonality with anybody somebody says, Sunil, which university did you go to? Oh, I'm also from Baroda. Then we start feeling comfortable right there. Then he says then which year you are? More we find we have more in common more we like each other more we fall in love with each other.

In other words, we find more identification with that person. So here now he is finding that everything that he knows is now him. So he is offering his salutation. Then he suddenly realizes that maybe when I was not aware of this fact that I may have insulted people. I may have insulted people who I should be actually respecting in this case. Obviously he superimposed all of that into Krishna Because Krishna is the one who showed me this Vishwaroop.

So he identifies that as the Krishna's self I am seeing. I Arjuna, seeing Krishna's self as this great cosmic being who is everywhere and everything. Therefore Hare Ram, Hare Krishna which is Swami Prabhupada movement they call it Krishna consciousness Lineage from Sankaracharya is the consciousness self consciousness. Myself and yourself is one and the same. Prabhupada comes from a different lineage which is a dualistic school of thought. They look at the Bhagavad Gita same way except a slight different twist and they will say the Krishna consciousness, my consciousness right now ego consciousness identify the Krishna consciousness.

Then I become one with Krishna, the Krishna, not that historical Krishna but the universal being. So here Arjuna sees the same way as this is the Krishna's great cosmic form. I have known Krishna from my childhood as Devaki's son, Yasuda's son, my cousin but look at his greatness. Sakha, Ithimatva, Prasabham Yad Uktam. Not knowing your greatness I may have addressed you disrespectfully. This may not be appropriate for a great man like you.

When I came to this country this is the biggest problem I had Here everybody called everybody first name. Obviously I was trained in India. And I said o', Neil, you can call. I say he's the president of our company of 200 people pharma. I am not going to call him David. No, no, it's okay, call him David.

But very difficult for us to do that boy, how can I say? Even today after living here for 30 years I have a client named Charles McFarlane and obviously we call him Charles. You know, he's about my age, so much younger than me. His father is 80 something and he used to be our senator Granger McFarlane. But he's also part of this project which I'm doing. So Charles will call my father.

Everybody called him Granger. I said I'm not going to do that. I call him Mr. McFarlane and called Charles Charles. That's how I make distinction. When I call Charles, I call him Charles and I call his father Mr. McFarlane. So now Arjuna realizing he said I must have done not something right, I called you Saka.

So ajanata mahimanam avedam not that I want to disrespect you but I did not know your greatness that you are that all pervading being. See, till we want to see God, we are not one with him and therefore we are always say oh God, you are so almighty. We never say O my own self which is almighty. Because who is seeking this relief from pain and unhappiness? Actually the sufferer right now is none other than my ego. Something happens who gets hurt?

So who needs liberation? My ego can never be the God's self. So my ego says oh forgive me Lord. So here Arjuna says O forgive me. In not knowing your greatness I must have called you Saka Yadav Krishna whatever Maya pramadat pranayana maapi pramadat out of my lethargy in understanding you I could have realized what I'm realizing today had I given enough thought to it. But it never occurred to me that I should put enough effort to know you.

So pramada pranayana vapya Therefore I must have done this thing out of love for you. I liked you, I loved you. Just did not know your greatness. Therefore I could not give you the due respect which you deserve Just continuing that Yacha avaha sartham asat krutosi vihara sayya asana bhujanesho While we are together, roaming around, sleeping in the same room, eating dinner, whatever, eating things together I must have asatkrutosi things disrespectfully to you. Eko athwa API achyuta tat tamaksam tat kshamaye tvam aham aprameyam or when we are just alone and I must have done that. So he said any situation he's just enumerating what situation I must have done this or in a company or we were together with some other people.

Sometimes I say oh, it's okay that you insulted me because nobody was here. That's not good that you did that in front of my friend. Maybe I did it alone. But I may have done it even in front of other people. All of the tat shamaye. Please forgive me O Aapramayyam.

Because you are immeasurable. Basically when an individual recognizing the Lord's greatness in a sense we come to recognize that we are powerless in this world. And everything that we have achieved is because of his presence. Then all credits we have taken, the ego we have developed, all that we feel so bad about it that I must have done all of this, O Lord out of my own ignorance. But please forgive me. He said why he should forgive him.

Let me tell you why you should forgive me. Because I know and I now recognize that you are Pitasi Lokasyachara Acharasya. You are the father of this entire Jagat made up of chara and Achara. That means everything. Then nothing you can leave behind in it. You are the most respectful, worshipable Guru Gariyan.

You are the greatest teacher of all. I did not know all this. You may take some blame for that. You are the greatest guru living with you also. I didn't learn all this thing. But you are the father of all the beingsamo Asti ABHI Adhikah.

There is no one greater than you. I now recognizing your almighty power. I thought he is powerful and he is powerful and she is powerful. And I was running after them. But I realized none When I divide this world into plurality again. You are because you are the powerhouse of everything.

In these three worlds. These three worlds can be defined in many different ways. One is obviously Swarga Lok Patal Lok in this Lok or a Swarga Nark and Prithvi Lok. But three Lokas generally in Vedanta. My three worlds are My waking world is my one world in which I have all these people who are more powerful than I am. And then I'm trying to gain their favor.

I'm trying to be in their company. Anytime we see somebody president comes Here, everybody say Mr. President, very glad to see you sir. President, very glad to see you also. He moves on because there are 5,000 people in a day. Probably tells him that. We put picture in our office.

Neil butt with Obama. Obama probably doesn't care. There are thousands of pictures like that. Pretty close relationship. We all have pictures with Swamiji. We were very close to Swamiji.

Was Swamiji close to us? But that's our ego basically tells us to do. But this also our way of showing respect. There is none greater than you. So in my waking world I have thought there are many. But none has power of their own.

They all derive power from you. So you are the greatest of all in my waking world. Same is true for my dream world. I derive power in my dream world because I am conscious. I am self aware in my dream. And my own mind creates my own world.

Even there, none greater than you. And when I'm in deep sleep, there is no one. I'm completely ignorant. In my deep sleep there is no thought. In deep sleep, you are the only one who takes care of me at the time. None greater than in these three worlds.

In the last verse we see Tasmad. Therefore Pranamya Pranidhaya Kayam. Therefore I bow down to with bending my body. Prasaday Tvam Hamishami Dyam Seeking your forgiveness, O adorable Lord. Now knowing your greatness, I adore you. We have learned what adoration is.

Intensive form of love. Intensive love is intense identification. I am now bowing down to you with my body, with my mind and my intellectual Pita Evaputrashya Just as the father forgives his son, no matter what son does, once he says, dad, I'm sorry, that's the end of the story. No matter how bad it was. Okay my son, don't do it ever again. But I'm letting you go.

And son knows that that trick works all the time. He said, because there's a love between the father and the son. No matter what it is, he forgives you. So you should do that. You are the father of the whole universe. That's another relationship where forgiveness comes very easy.

You and your friend are really mad at each other. And the other friend, you know, Neil, I'm so sorry I did that. That's the end of the story. Let's go see a movie together. It's a very different relationship. And then when you're in love, when somebody is beloved to you, no matter what differences you have.

And you're mad at each other, as soon as one person.

Obviously he superimposed all of that into Krishna Because Krishna is the one who showed me this Vishwaroop.

snippets.reflection:
Sit for a moment with the vastness of existence—billions of stars, billions of years, billions of beings. Let yourself feel small in the face of it all.

Then remember: you are not separate from this vastness. You are the universe looking at itself. Both the terror and the wonder are appropriate responses to ultimate reality.

The cosmic vision shows that time devours all things. What would change if you held this truth constantly in awareness? Would petty concerns still trouble you? Would you use your time differently?

snippets.title: Day 157: Return to Grace
snippets.sanskrit:
किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तं

श्रीभगवानुवाच |

न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानैर्-
snippets.transliteration:
kirīṭinaṃ gadinaṃ cakrahastaṃ icchāmi tvāṃ draṣṭumahaṃ tathaiva .

śrībhagavānuvāca .

na vedayajñādhyayanairna dānaira- na ca kriyābhirna tapobhirugraiḥ .
verseTranslations: I long to see Thee as thou wert before, with the crown, the sceptre and the discus in Thy hands; in Thy other Form, with Thy four hands, O Thou Whose arms are countless and Whose forms are infinite.

Lord Shri Krishna replied: My beloved friend! It is only through My grace and power that thou hast been able to see this vision of splendour, the Universal, the Infinite, the Original. Never has it been seen by any but thee.
Not by study of the scriptures, not by sacrifice or gift, not by ritual or rigorous austerity, is it possible for man on earth to see what thou hast seen, O thou foremost hero of the Kuru-clan!

The normal perception we have is I and the world exists. And therefore there is a duality.

There is a constant struggle between I and the world where I define myself as me and the world, everything else in the world, and then this world we divide into two, the world which I like and world which we don't like. So whole our life pursuit is to align with the world which I like and avoid the world which I don't like. Vedanta says, all over life, the pursuit is to avoid which is unpleasant and to gain what is pleasant. And this pursuit creates the friction, and that creates more unhappiness, more dissatisfaction, because almost everyone around me is trying to do the same thing. And then we are in competition to get out of that race. If I can get that vision of oneness, then I can have that everlasting peace that I am seeking.

So Bhagavan showed this roop to Arjuna. And Arjuna sees this world without any space and time. The dividing factor between I and the world is the space and time. And once that is taken off, I see this world as one entity ever strung into each other by a common thread. But this is an overwhelming picture for Arjunatua. So he said, I'm delighted to see this, but at the same time I am completely overwhelmed and I'm fearful.

So oh Lord, show me your form which is much gentler and which I am most comfortable with, which is that of Vishnu. We want to see Bhagavan in a form which is most comfortable to us, as we have discussed last time. So he says, show me with your form with the Kiritinam Gadinam, Chakrinam Hastam, with the crown and mace and Chakra which I'm so familiar with. Right from my childhood I've seen Vishnu's pictures and anytime somebody says, have you seen cosmic form? All of us say, oh yes, yeah, I've seen Bhagavad Gita pictures and you know, Shiva. Sure, because we have seen all the paintings of Shiva.

So we had a familiarity. We have formed an image of God in our head and any image other than that we are not comfortable with the whole understanding that this Almighty is nothing but the source of all these beings and there's all these beings is not really comforting thought. As the Lord, therefore very conveniently we divide the world which is good. Everything good happening is divine, bad happening is evil, Tsunami is evil, earthquake is evil. But in reality it's all part of the whole phenomena called this world. There's nothing evil or good about it.

Arjuna asked for that and then Bhagavan said in his response, Maya prasanne tava Arjuna, Idam Rupam Param Darsitam, Atma Yoga, last verse which you have seen. With my Yoga, with my power of changing your perception, I have showed you my rope. Not that the roof was never unavailable. It is always available to those who can see it. Radio waves are always here for those who can tune into it.

It does not mean that we are not tuning into it. Form was always there. Arjuna did not have capacity to see it. But if my yoga gave you that perception which was Tejomayam Vishwam, Anantam, Yadyam, Yanmetva Anniyana, Drishta Purva, the splendid and all encompassing Vishwam, all pervading infinite form which you have seen and not seen by other before, then there are somebody saying that's not true. Krishna already showed it to Jashoda. This is not an argument about the Puranas saying, who saw it first?

It's the argument about no one in this state of mind, state of evolution, state of understanding has seen this thing. If I can say, well, I actually saw it while driving down to my work yesterday, well, that's not true, not going to happen. Because then I won't be able to drive because I miss that whole perception. The road in my car and me. I can't have these two together. Perception of me and this world and the me and the world is one and the same all at the same time.

Therefore I say, nobody has seen it before you, you remaining you. Arjuna has seen this form. And then why this is not seen by others? Because others are trying to say this by the means which they find it most convenient and appropriate to them. But do they really turn out to be the best as we see it? Because what they are looking for, or let's put it this way, we think we have done the best for them to make them happy.

Naveda, Yajna, Adhyayan, Nadane, chakriya bhi na tapo bhi ugrahi. Others are trying, not other, all others are trying in this world by the Veda, Veda, Dhyana, by learning Vedas, we want to learn. So we want to get the knowledge which we think the others have. So we learn Veda, Yajna, all the things which we think is good. Because if you do that it multiplies so many times. So Dana, we obviously value the Importance of charity. So we have this notion that doing Dana, I get the merits and that merit will earn me to see that source of infinite happiness, the Lord Veda.

Yagna, Dhyana Dana, Kriya bhi, Kriya bhi. Now actions, obviously they translate as rituals, you know, because religious actions in traditional sense is ritual. That I have to do this Archana or I have to do this Puja because that gives me merits or do austerities or poas. This many Guru Sukruvar Sahniva will do this, this many, all this. We are doing it to ultimately find what that source of happiness which is infinite. I want that unconditioned happiness, unending happiness.

And I want to do that by gaining this Bhagavan very clearly say, na veda nad na kriyabhi na tapobi. It's not that Bhagavan is condemning this. Somewhat in a putting it down tone, I said this. That's not the intention. Those are the means to prepare your mind and intellect to level where he will shine through. We have discussed that a seeker's job is only to do the Antharkarana Shuddhe.

Our job is this mind with these impurities. We need to just clean up the impurities. All this we have discussed is actually just for the Antakarana Shuddhe.

Veda, Dhyana, Yajna, Tapa Dhaana, Kriya. All that is to Antakaran Shuddhi. If you are doing it for Antakaran Shuddhi, it will gain its results. This is all I have to do and I'm done with it. And therefore he says, you are not getting it. So Bhagavan said, evam rupya sakya aham nuloke.

This form of mind not possible by this in this world of man, our world. Drastum tvat anniena kuru pravera Arjuna is kuru praveer or the best among the kuru. It is not possible in this world other than you to see this by only being doing this because these are the means and not the end which we normally confuse this as an end. Next verse we just seen is mate vyatama. But obviously now this is a verse which shows what state Arjuna was in. Mate vyatama cha vimooda bhavah.

But don't be disturbed and don't be fearful. I can see clearly on your face that you are disturbed, overwhelmed and fearful by looking at this terrible form of mind. Dristva rupam ghauram idruk mama idham. Having seen such a terrible form of mine, See again there's somewhere in the translation it says terrific form of mind. But say Gauram and say terrible. Whether it is terrible is terrific is who decides that?

From our point of view something may be terrible. From some other perspective it is terrific when somebody is taking those pictures of tsunamis from a distance from some satellite and then we are seeing those such a terrific form of tsunami. But guy at that whatever the beach where the tsunami is coming in Japan or wherever that is, it's a terrible form of tsunami. So he said, having seen this terrible form of mind, because you seeing it as a jiva, as a limited being, trying to comprehend this overwhelming nature of the self, it's a terrible form. Vyapeta bhi prithamanah with your fear dispelled, get your fear out and prithvamanah have a loving nature again. Punastvam tadeva me roopam idam prapsya.

And now see this roop which will get your fear off and a loving form. And now comes a little bit of a controversy. Bhagavan showed it to Arjuna when he came back from his Virat Swarupa to this. Now obviously he asked for Kritinam gadinam chakrinam Haslam. You know, Vishnu Roop Bhagavad Gita really doesn't say that. Some commentaries have said Bhagavad Gita simply says he came back to his original song form as Vasudev Krishna.

We are doing it to ultimately find what that source of happiness which is infinite. I want that unconditioned happiness, unending happiness.

And I want to do that by gaining this Bhagavan very clearly say, na veda nad na kriyabhi na tapobi. It's not that Bhagavan is condemning this. Somewhat in a putting it down tone, I said this. That's not the intention. Those are the means to prepare your mind and intellect to level where he will shine through. We have discussed that a seeker's job is only to do the Antharkarana Shuddhe.

As per our Veda Vedanta. Our job is simply to make our Antakana internal instrument which is mind and intellect, to clean it up, make it ready for his reflection into it. Because right now it is so clouded with all the layers or the layers of our vasanas on it that the reflection is not clear. We have seen in Vedanta 3 Types of impurities can be. The one is more like smoke in front of a mirror. While you can't see a reflection that is smoke in front of the mirror.

Well, it is very easy to dispel the smoke. But then others leave the dust layer on that. And third, we say, just as in the womb the fetus is enveloped into the matter which is even more difficult. Our job is this mind with these impurities. We need to just clean up the impurities. All this we have discussed is actually just for the Antakarana Shuddhe.

Veda, Dhyana, Yajna, Tapa Dhaana, Kriya. All that is to Antakaran Shuddhi. If you are doing it for Antakaran Shuddhi, it will gain its results. This is all I have to do and I'm done with it. And therefore he says, you are not getting it. So Bhagavan said, evam rupya sakya aham nuloke.

This form of mind not possible by this in this world of man, our world. Drastum tvat anniena kuru pravera Arjuna is kuru praveer or the best among the kuru. It is not possible in this world other than you to see this by only being doing this because these are the means and not the end which we normally confuse this as an end. Next verse we just seen is mate vyatama. But obviously now this is a verse which shows what state Arjuna was in. Mate vyatama cha vimooda bhavah.

But don't be disturbed and don't be fearful. I can see clearly on your face that you are disturbed, overwhelmed and fearful by looking at this terrible form of mind. Dristva rupam ghauram idruk mama idham. Having seen such a terrible form of mine, See again there's somewhere in the translation it says terrific form of mind. But say Gauram and say terrible. Whether it is terrible is terrific is who decides that?

From our point of view something may be terrible. From some other perspective it is terrific when somebody is taking those pictures of tsunamis from a distance from some satellite and then we are seeing those such a terrific form of tsunami. But guy at that whatever the beach where the tsunami is coming in Japan or wherever that is, it's a terrible form of tsunami. So he said, having seen this terrible form of mind, because you seeing it as a jiva, as a limited being, trying to comprehend this overwhelming nature of the self, it's a terrible form. Vyapeta bhi prithamanah with your fear dispelled, get your fear out and prithvamanah have a loving nature again. Punastvam tadeva me roopam idam prapsya.

And now see this roop which will get your fear off and a loving form. And now comes a little bit of a controversy. Bhagavan showed it to Arjuna when he came back from his Virat Swarupa to this. Now obviously he asked for Kritinam gadinam chakrinam Haslam. You know, Vishnu Roop Bhagavad Gita really doesn't say that. Some commentaries have said Bhagavad Gita simply says he came back to his original song form as Vasudev Krishna.
snippets.reflection:
Sit for a moment with the vastness of existence—billions of stars, billions of years, billions of beings. Let yourself feel small in the face of it all.

Then remember: you are not separate from this vastness. You are the universe looking at itself. Both the terror and the wonder are appropriate responses to ultimate reality.

The cosmic vision shows that time devours all things. What would change if you held this truth constantly in awareness? Would petty concerns still trouble you? Would you use your time differently?

snippets.title: Day 159: Universal Vision
snippets.sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |

नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया |

भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन |
snippets.transliteration:
śrībhagavānuvāca .

nāhaṃ vedairna tapasā na dānena na cejyayā .

bhaktyā tvananyayā śakya ahamevaṃvidho.arjuna .
verseTranslations: Lord Shri Krishna replied: It is hard to see this vision of Me that thou hast seen. Even the most powerful have longed for it in vain.
Not by study of the scriptures, or by austerities, not by gifts or sacrifices, is it possible to see Me as thou hast done.
Only by tireless devotion can I be seen and known; only thus can a man become one with Me, O Arjuna!
snippets.commentary:
We have been discussing chapter 11, Viswarupadarsana yoga. Yoga of Revelation of the Cosmic Form. So we have seen in this chapter that Bhagavan showed his cosmic form. So what does that mean? Cosmic form is that form which includes all the forms in this cosmos, in this world, in this Jagat. So all the forms at one place, from past, present and future.

So that negates time. If there is no past, present and future, there is no time. If there is only one entity, one supreme being, then there is no time. I don't require any time to meet myself. I am always there, so there is no time required. It is when I have to meet somebody else, then I have to have time.

The two, it requires time and we can say we'll meet at 10 o' clock every Sunday morning. So as long as there are more than one, there will be time. If there's only one, there is no time. So in this cosmic form, everything is crunched into one. Past, present, future. There is no time also.

If there is one, there is no space. If there is one dot, the dot doesn't require any space. Instead of two dots, there is a distance between the two and there's space between the two. The space is created only when there are two. So in this, all forms are in one. Therefore there is no space also.

Because all forms are within that one form, that one form now becomes the form, the cosmic form. And therefore there is no space. So the space and time are both negated. In cosmic form, to have any form, what you require is space and time. Without space and time, there is no form. So the actual vision that Arjuna had was that of a formless space, supreme being.

But then he describes all these beings in it, I see Brahma, I see Vishnu, I see all the Siddhas, I see all Rakshasas, I see Dhritarashtra, the Sons. So in the supreme, all the probabilities, infinite probabilities, the infinite amount of forms you can imagine, you can create in that infinite. It is something like if one of my Clients come to me and say that Neil, here is a piece of land. Design a building, I said, but what kind of a building? What do you want to use it for? If you leave everything up to me, I have infinite possibilities what I can design, what type of building I can design.

There I can say it can be hospital, it can be jail. Well, it can be office building, it can be multi storied office building. Maybe it's a single story office building. No, no, it can be residential. Well, maybe multi storage. Infinite possibilities.

To really design a building I have to eliminate all other possibilities and narrow it down to one. It can be hospital because it's not possible here, not needed here. It cannot be jailed because we have no authority to imprison anybody. So let's not do imprison. Have to come down to negate everything with only one choice and that becomes my choice. So for any form that's necessary that you should negate all other forms.

So when I say, let's say Prakashji comes to the room and I see Prakash Ji, what I have to do is I have to negate all 7 billion people on this planet. That all remaining 7 billion people is not that, that's Prakash ji. So to create a form from a probability of infinite probabilities in supreme, I have to negate all other probabilities. So here Arjuna can see whatever he wants to see. So is the case with us, because we see from a narrow perspective and we negate things and it comes down to a particular form. So here Bhagwana showed Arjuna the supreme form which is formless but has infinite probabilities and possibilities of forms.

So that was the reason. And therefore Arjuna could see things which are delightful and those frightful. When it comes to the delightful, when we think about God as divine, it is very pleasant to think about God. But when we think about God who is also responsible or he is also enabling the evil in this world is very frightful. Therefore we say, Bhagavan, I don't want to see that part of yours. Show me something which I can live with.

So that's what we have seen so far. Arjuna requested, put me back where I was before. So Bhagavan showed him the same Swarupa as Vasudeva, as Vasudeva's son which he was before as his charioteer. And then Bhagavan told him that, look, this form of mind which you have seen, which has all the Forms included in any past, present, future is very difficult to see. It is auspicious but very difficult to see. And therefore nobody has seen it before.

You have seen it simply because of my grace, Atma, Yoga. By my yoga I could make you see this thing. But it is not possible to see through all the other preparations. Learning Veda, Dhyana, Yajna, their means but not the goal. You cannot achieve the goal by just preparing for it. Na aham vedena tapasa, nadanea, ijya, shakya evam Vidav drastum, as you have seen, is not possible through study of Vedas or austerities, on charities or even sacrifices.

It almost looks like Bhagavan is discouraging us. None of this is going to be helpful. Bhagawan is actually making statement of fact. We can learn from this verse the secret of success in anything. So just by going to architecture school, I can become a successful architect. Many of my classmates are in the United States.

They all went to the same school. We all got the architecture degree. None of them are practicing architecture. They're successful in what they are doing. They own motels, they own gas stations and big houses and many cars. But they're not practicing architecture.

So just by going to architecture school, I cannot become a successful architect. So is this case with the doctors, engineers. So what makes a person a successful professional? The first is his devotion to the profession. He has to be devoted to his profession. When I came to this country, big recession time, 1982, huge recession, I was in Houston.

So pipe drafting was big thing there because it was all companies there. And then you'll forget about architecture, do pipe drafting, you will make a lot of money. And I said, there's one thing I will not do is leave architecture. I'll find jobs somewhere. Even drafting in architecture acceptable, but not pipe drafting. So unless you are devoted to a profession, so that's the first requirement, that also doesn't make me successful as designer of buildings because I need grace of my clients.

I may be the best architect on this planet, but there is no client that I can convince that I can design his or her building. Then I won't be able to design. So to become a successful architect who can design a building and construct it, I need grace of my clients. So ultimate thing I need is a grace from whom I am seeking that work, all that achievement. But to get there, I have to do a lot more. I can't really just come out and say I'm devoted to architecture and Give me work.

That's also not possible. You have to train yourself continuously. So that you become proficient and efficient. Then somebody will see that you are capable of doing so. So Bhagavan said, two things I require. One is your devotion to your goal.

And then grace from whoever is the fruit giver. Whoever is responsible to give you that work or that achievement. So Bhagavan said, Na aham vedh tapasana Dhaneana ijjaya sake evam vidodrastum drasvanasimyata is you have seen me. I am not possible to be seen through all these things. We think that preparing ourselves is good enough. But once it is not good enough, what you require is Baksyatu Ananya Sakya aham Eva Vidha Arjuna Gnatum drastum Chatatwena Praveshtum chaparantapa.

It is not possible by just preparation. If you are devoted to me, Bhaktiyatu Ananya. By single minded devotion it is possible the Bhagawan has given you the secret. But what you really require is single pointed devotion. And devotion as we have discussed many times is nothing but love for the divine. And love is nothing but identification.

I love someone because I identify with that person. Because I identify with this class. I like to discuss Bhagavad Gita. You like to discuss Bhagavad Gita. I love people who come to this class. So this identification is love.

I don't love my neighbour's child. As much as I love my own child. I identify with my child, my son. So love is nothing but pure identification. Without identification you cannot love anything or any being. So love for the divine is devotion.

But I cannot love the divine without knowing the divine. And therefore Bhagavan spent last five chapters to define what the divine is. Culminated into this Viswaroo Pradarshan. So Bhagavan said it is possible. And then Bhagavan gives the steps of that vision. Gnatum drastum cha tatvena praveshtum chaparandapa.

First you have to know. For identifying with anyone. I need to know that person. I have to know that person. I can't fall in love with a girl who I never met. I have to know her first.

So gnatum knowing first. In our studies we say the first is Savannam. Listen to the Scriptures listen to the nature of the Lord. So this is what we are doing. We are listening from Bhagavan. Then you will see me.

Then you will know me. You will see me in my essence. Wherever I see, I see you. So that's the vision Drastram. So in our path of Bhakti Mananam reflection, I create a perception of what I have learned. The Bhagavan's form is like that.

And then I reflect on it. Have you seen carry catchers of Vishwarupdarshan? The painters painted the iconic calendars. We all have seen Bhagavan with many heads and many arms and fire coming out of his mouth. Painters and limitations. But if you have listened to the five chapters carefully and then you reflect on it then Bhagavan said, you will see me in my essence.

The last stage is Praveshtum. Then you will identify with me. Pravisham is to become one. Enter into that self. So I am right now in my limited being. I'm completely identified with this body, this mind, this intellect.

I call me identify so complete that there is no real rivalry between my right hand and left hand, my right leg and left leg. So the complete identification with this limited self I.e. praveshtam entered into that me. Bhagavan said, if you reflect on that Viswaroop then you will also enter into that. You will identify with that supreme as you identify with your limited self right now. Here the operative word is Ananya Bhakti.

With single minded devotion, you shall be able to know me. You shall be able to see me. You shall be able to enter into me. The last word he gives us how to do that. So first he says, this vision is not possible without my grace. But it is possible if you are single mindedly devoted to me.

But how can I develop that single minded devotion? If now Bhagavan is saying in the last verse of this chapter, Mat Karma Krat very first thing he said, do everything for me. Continue doing everything you're doing right now. You think you're doing it for you. You're doing it for your family, you're doing it for your country. He said, just think, it's all me.

snippets.title: Day 161: The Path of Devotion
snippets.sanskrit:
अर्जुन उवाच |

श्रीभगवानुवाच |

ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते |
snippets.transliteration:
arjuna uvāca .

śrībhagavānuvāca .

ye tvakṣaramanirdeśyamavyaktaṃ paryupāsate .
verseTranslations: "Arjuna asked: My Lord! Which are the better devotees who worship Thee, those who try to know Thee as a Personal God, or those who worship Thee as Impersonal and Indestructible?
Lord Shri Krishna replied: Those who keep their minds fixed on Me, who worship Me always with unwavering faith and concentration; these are the very best.
snippets.commentary:
Shri Purohit Swami did not comment on this sloka

What is my purpose and destiny? So we had been discussing chapter one, Arjuna's Grief. Arjuna, Vishada, Yoga. This is a contradictory term, Vishada and Yoga. Grief cannot be in Yoga, we are always in Yoga. When we are in grief, this is the one time we really align ourselves to our own self, seeking for an answer, how do I get out of this grief?

So grief also is one form of Yoga. In fact, it aligns you more to your own reality than when the time is good, then we are more outwardly seeking things outside. When we are in grief, we are seeking inward and say, how do I get out of this sorrow and find peace? So therefore this chapter is also called Yoga, Yoga of Arjuna's Grief. And the grief basically started with his looking at his situation. So so far we have seen that Dhritarashtra was curious what's going on out of his ignorance about what's happening.

Curiosity is the manifestation of ignorance. Unless we are ignorant, we cannot be curious. We can only be curious about something we are ignorant about. We cannot be curious about something we already know. So Dhritarashtra, being ignorant about what's going on, he's curious about what's happening at the battlefield of Kurukshetra, he asked Sanjaya. And then what we have seen is Sanjay's narration.

Sanjaya first narrated what Duryodhan was doing. Duryodhana has gauged his situation, came to the conclusion we may not have enough resources. And then Bheeshma declared the war by blowing his own conch. And once he blew his conch, everybody blew their own conch. Now we have seen that the situation is such that everybody blew their own conches. And there was so much sound, there was so much chaos that everybody were trembling with fear.

Now we are coming back to what Arjuna is doing. So the last three verses we have seen, it says Vyavasthitan, Dhrushtva, Dhatrastra and Kapit Dvajaha. Having seen this, the army of Duryodhana, Dharatarashtra, the Kauraval army assembled in the battlefield Kapit dwajah. One whose flag has a monkey, Hanuman. We don't say Kapidwajahai here. Basically Hanuman is a symbol of air, Maruta shyaputraha.
